story:
****If you would like to receive a perk, please be sure to click on "Get This Perk." If you accidentally donate without selecting a perk, and you would like to receive the associated perk, email us to let us know: info@seoulshakespeare.com.****

 

Introduction

Every spring, Seoul Shakespeare Company brings together a cast and crew of talented people from a variety of backgrounds to produce one of Shakespeare’s works in Seoul’s theatre district. While there are many Korean-language productions of Shakespeare’s works here, we’re the only company that performs Shakespeare’s original text in English, making each of our productions a unique contribution to the artistic community here. 

Our productions are funded entirely by donations and ticket sales. Theater rental is very expensive, and so each year we hold a fundraising campaign to help with the costs of mounting the production. In return, we thank our backers through our social media and printed show programs and offer an assortment of gifts to show our gratitude.

On The Merchant of Venice

This year’s production, The Merchant of Venice, is a deceptively complex play. Each character treads a complicated, morally ambiguous line, and the play can be approached in many different ways. One of the main features of this play is that it presents key questions and choices for each actor. Audiences are often curious about how the character of Shylock will be played—whether he’ll be a villain or a victim.  But, perhaps less famously, every actor in this play has to deal with these kinds of questions because every character in this play is written as a messy, complex person, full of dualities and contradictions. Each actor in rehearsals is doing a balancing act between different possibilities. And so the characters’ relationships are constantly shifting, making the nature of this particular production a constantly forming process. Our challenge is to find the most interesting answers to those questions.

One of the most compelling features of this play is that each character is convinced that he or she is right, and through them we see multiple sides to each conflict. An audience’s sympathies may shift back and forth between characters, and there are no moral and ethical certainties, but only continually shifting grey areas. And not just in the role of Shylock, but in all the characters in this play, we see Shakespeare’s recurring fascination with the complexity of humanity, and particularly our flaws and wrong choices. That’s part of what makes Shakespeare such a brilliant playwright, and why his works are so intriguing.

 

Your backing of this show will help us to pay for our theater rental, rehearsal space, costumes, props, and set and ensure that we can continue to put on productions like this in the future. And if you’re in Korea, we hope you’ll come see the show! 

 

More About this Project

Impact

By contributing to this production, you will help to bring the brilliance of Shakespeare to diverse audiences in Korea. In addition, you will be supporting a diverse artistic community in Seoul and allowing us to continue to create theatrical art in Korea’s international community.  

An Introduction to Seoul Shakespeare Company

Seoul Shakespeare Company is an all-volunteer theatre company that brings Shakespeare’s works to Seoul audiences in English, with Korean subtitles. We have existed since 2010, and have put on fully-staged productions since 2011. We typically produce one major show per year in Korea's theatre district of Daehangno, with smaller fundraising events throughout the year, as well as acting workshops that are open to the community.

We serve three main populations in Korea: 

1) Korean audience members (including students) who would like to see Shakespeare performed in the original language, 

2) English-speaking audience members (including students from international schools) who would like to see theatre performed in a language they understand 

3) English-speakers (both foreign and Korean) who want to participate in making theatre and hone their craft in the theatrical arts. 

By being an all-volunteer company, we are able to allow people of all nationalities to participate freely in the creation of theatre. At the same time, we aim to put on productions that are professional in quality, so that we are worth the time and effort of people who are serious about a future career in the theatre. Some of our past company members are now pursuing a professional career in theatre in other countries, and one of our core purposes is to provide an opportunity for English-speaking theatre people living in Korea to continue to develop their craft, while also contributing positively to Korean society.

Our recent productions of The Winter’s Tale and Much Ado About Nothing were very popular with audiences, defying expectations of what could be done in Seoul's theatre community, and have also marked the expansion of interest in our company among international schools in particular, bringing many groups of English-speaking students from these schools to attend our performances. For many in our audience (not just students), our shows are their first exposure to live theatre or to live Shakespeare performance in particular.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give directly to our production, you can help us by sharing our campaign through social media, and, if you're in Korea, coming to our show!  

 

Korean Bank Transfer Option

If you have a Korean bank account, you can contribute via bank transfer.  Your contribution won't show up in our Indiegogo total, but we can still send you the perks listed above.  Send us an email to let us know that you've contributed, and whether you would like to receive the associated perks, and we'll add you to our list of donors.  Here is a link to our bank information: https://www.seoulshakespearecompany.org/make-a-... 

 

Thank you for anything you are able to give to support this production!

 

This year, for the first time, we are also seeking business sponsorships, exchanging ad space in our printed programs and social media for the support of (mostly local) businesses. If you have a business that you would like to promote by becoming a sponsor, you can find more information here: https://www.seoulshakespearecompany.org/busines... 


Show page for The Merchant of Venice: https://www.seoulshakespearecompany.org/the-mer...

Ticket Reservation Form: https://www.seoulshakespearecompany.org/ticket-...
 

Seoul Shakespeare Company Home Page: https://www.seoulshakespearecompany.org/ 

Seoul Shakespeare Company Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/seoulshakespeare/

Join our email list to receive announcements directly to your inbox:  http://seoulshakespearecompany.us12.list-manage... 

Seoul Shakespeare Company Email: 

info@seoulshakespeare.com

 

Email for questions about ticketing:

sscticketing@gmail.com 

 

 

CAST

Servingwoman 1: Heather McRae

Servingwoman 2: Katy Wood

Servingwoman 3 / Duke: Mira Weidman 

Antonio: Jamie Horan

Salerio / Morocco: Tarquinn Whitebooi

Solanio: Robert Jung

Bassanio: Jeffrey Wagner

Lorenzo / Arragon: Charles Jeong

Gratiano: Chris Zaczek

Portia: Lauren Ash-Morgan

Nerissa: Angie Ahn

Shylock: Josh Kroot

Lancelot Gobbo / Tubal / Jailer: Jason Cutler

Jessica: Carrie Jo van der Walt

​

CREW

Director: Michael Downey

SSC Artistic Director & Producer: Lauren Ash-Morgan

Stage Manager: Makrenna Sterdan

Lighting Designer: John Campbell

Costume Design/Construction: Lauren Ash-Morgan

Music Director: Lauren Ash-Morgan

Interpreter/Translator: Charles Jeong

Venue Coordinator: Charles Jeong

Surtitles English Transcription: Jamie Horan

Surtitles Translator: Charles Jeong

story:
Trio De Femmes En Mexico

We believe that engaging in intercultural dialogue through artistic collaboration and conversation initiates a process of healing and understanding, which in may in turn lead to authentic social and societal advancement.  We want to develop and refine this performance piece and this process, so that we are able to share it and connect with a wider international audience. 

Trio de Femmes are committed to creating and holding space for the deeper conversations around our engendered experience and openly invite artists from a diverse range of cultural backgrounds to enter this space with us. We wish to expose and recognise our societal programming and go beyond these limited beliefs and perspectives. Ultimately we want to delve into the universal heart of the matter and create a rich, inclusive tapestry that celebrates everyone.

What We Need & What You Get

Trio De Femmes are asking for $3000 funding for this campaign. This is just under 50% of our total proposed budget for the Mexico project. This will go toward covering our expenses for flights, basic daily living costs in Mexico for the week, venue hire, technical support, documentation and most importantly paying the Mexican artists we are collaborating with. 

  • We are excited by the wide array of creative and personal perks and incentives we are offering you; arty postcards, cute personal handwritten letters, avant guard bespoke poetry, original artwork, singing tributes, mystery gifts and even a personal performance in your own home!
  •  If by some strange twist of fate, we don't reach our entire goal, we will  carry on like troopers with the project. Coz we are Trio De Femmes and ain't nothin' gonna stop us!!

The Impact

In Mexico we will gather information related to our themes exploring gender, feminism, cultural approaches to sex and sexuality and queer identity.  This exploration  will help develop the performance and complexify our artistic process. As three women co-creating universally relevant work based on our personal stories, we innately and explicitly encourage the work of women in general as well as of all people sensitive to investigating and expanding the local and universal feminine energy.  We are excited to be working intensely with the awesome team of Mexican collaborators led by Kabriele Rosas and Alejandro Guevara.  

Trio De Femmes have a direct style of communication that openly invites audiences to have a real experience of being seen, loved, accepted and not alone. We have had very meaningful post show conversations with audience members and our future planning includes workshops and discussions in conjunction with the performance.

Your support will go towards maximizing the success of this valuable and unique collaboration and furthering this convention breaking work. We sincerely appreciate you for your desire to support us.

Risks & Challenges

We are three hardworking women with many full time commitments. This is the first time we are setting up a crowdfunding campaign, and we know how much work they are from our friends and fellow artists that we ourselves have supported. We are aware that it will be a big challenge for us all to keep up the momentum required to advertise and share our project widely and to connect with those who might be excited by what we are attempting to do, and who would value what have to offer and feel awesome in supporting and the receiving the cool gifts on offer.

  • We really wholeheartedly believe in this project and we believe in the community.
  • We will do everything we can to approach this project as we do all our work; with excitement, creativity and honest open hearts.
  • We are committed to staying engaged with our supporters, keeping them entertained and involved and discovering ways to overcome tiredness, boredom, procrastination and lack of confidence with a creative answer!!!

Other Ways You Can Help

Trio De Femmes appreciate all manner of support. It is not just about dollars.

  • Help us get the word out and create a buzz around this groovy campaign and the issues we are addressing by joining and liking our campaign and sharing posts with your social networks, family, friends and groups.
  • Your own kind and funny messages and comments help to give us a boost too!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Your own kind and funny messages and comments help to give us a boost too!
Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Who are you and what do you want?

Hi, my name is Arkadiy Stepanchuk, and I love making people smile through dance. I am the founder of DuDance, a non-profit organization that spreads the joy and power of dance through various projects (e.g. The Smile Experiment), events (e.g. Dance Therapy for Depression), and classes (e.g. teaching autistic children).

We at DuDance LOVE dancing so much that we are driving across the USA connecting and making people smile by dancing with them.

Wait, what? You’re doing what?

Yes, you read that correctly: we are spreading smiles across the country through dance! From East to West, we will be stopping at dozens of locations and dancing with people to make them smile.

That sounds silly. Have you ever done this before?

Yes, and with great success in half a dozen cities! It’s called The Smile Experiment and from NYC to LA we’ve already made thousands of people smile physically and hundreds of thousands of people smile virtually. 

Okay, but why are you even doing this if you've already proven your experiment?

More! More! We want more!

But the evidence is already there! People will smile when you dance with them.

Okay, you got us! Not only will we be filming The Smile Experiment, but we will also be capturing powerful stories of how dance has improved people’s lives. This will become an 8 part web series called Dance for Life.

Hmm, whose lives?

From Parkinson's and MS patients to children fighting cancer to people battling depression, there are people who are using dance not just as a game or hobby but as a life-saving medicine. You will help educate the world about how we can use dance as a tool to improve, and even save, lives!

Now I am intrigued. What do you need from me?

As you could have guessed, traveling across the country with a crew is not cheap. From travel expenses to hiring an Emmy award-winning crew to equipment rental, the expenses are pretty steep. And as much as we love making people smile through dance, I cannot do it alone. That is why I am asking you to share and contribute to our campaign to help us spread the joy and power of dance.

Where is the money going?

Maybe this will make things clearer:

  

Any extra money we raise and do not use towards the trip expenses will go towards post-production and towards producing even more Dance for Life episodes. There is a countless number of stories to tell! (And NO, I am not paying myself anything. Just my crew. I get paid in people's smiles when I dance with them. And in the people we influence to dance!)

Okay, but what will I get if I contribute?

Through The Smile Experiment and the Dance for Life series, you will help show thousands, if not millions, of people the JOY AND POWER OF DANCE! But for real, you will also get rewarded for your good karma. Check out the perks we are offering below. You can also see them to the right.

If you are a dancer, dance coach, studio owner, dancetrepeneur, or just simply a dance lover, you cannot not miss this opportunity to back this project and get the country, and world, dancing more! 

We really hope you will contribute to our campaign and become a DuDancer*!

*DuDancer - one who believes in the joy and power of dance and shares it 

PERKS

Pledge $10 - Become a DuDancer!

Part of Thank You Video. We'll create a “Thank You” video listing the names of all the contributors to the backdrop of the people we dance with on this trip.

Download of The Smile Experiment Cross Country Video. We’ll send you a high resolution file of the finished video of The Smile Experiment - Cross Country. If you want to share the joy and power of dance with anyone, you’ll be able to without any copyright on our end. 

Pledge $20 - Become a Super DuDancer!

Custom postcard from the trip. We will be creating custom post cards for every major city/landmark that we visit.

Plus everything in the $10 tier.

Pledge $50 - Become a Super Trendy DuDancer! 

“Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” T-Shirt. Stand out in the crowd and show everyone how much you love dance with a “Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” T-Shirt! Get it in Black or White.

Plus everything in the $20 tier.

Pledge $75 - Become a Super Duper DuDancer!

Set of 6 custom postcards from the trip. Start your Custom DuDance postcard collection early!

Plus everything in the $50 tier.

Pledge $125 - Become a Super Duper Trendy DuDancer!

“Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” Hoodie. Show how much you love DuDancing, all whilst staying warm and trendy.

Plus everything in the $75 tier.

Pledge $250 - Become a Caring DuDancer!

Custom Message Posted on our Facebook Page. Perfect for those who love dance, or who want their dance related brand to be seen by 22K dance lovers. We will create a personal video shoutout thanking you (or your brand/organization) and will post it on our FB page! (One of our videos reached over 4 million views!)

Plus everything in the $125 tier.

Pledge $500 - Become a Savvy DuDancer!

Promote your brand with us! If you’re a dance studio owner or sell dance related products/services, you cannot miss this opportunity to promote your brand via the DuDance network. We will share any 4 posts/videos/photos with our 22K followers on FB; all of whom LOVE dancing! This is on top of receiving a personalized video shoutout posted directly on our page. 

Plus everything in the $250 tier.

Pledge $2500 - Become a DuDancer Producer!

Become a Producer! Get Producer credits for all first 8 episodes of the Dance for Life series! Your funding will help influence thousands of people to improve their lives through dance. Grow your name's brand (or brand's name) with Producer credits.

Plus everything in the $500 tier.

Pledge $7500 - Become an Executive DuDancer!

Become an Executive Producer! Get Executive Producer credits for all 8 episodes of the Dance for Life series! Your funding will help with the post production of this web series and help build your name's brand (or brand's name), depends on if you fund personally or for your organization.

Plus everything in the $500 tier.

Meet the Team

Arkadiy Stepanchuk

Arkadiy loves dancing and he most definitely does not hide it. Being a professionally trained ballroom dancer for over a decade, he now trains students of all backgrounds. From autistic children to Senior Citizens, he uses the DuDance platform to show that anyone can, and should, dance! 

Julia Gorbach

Julia is an Emmy award-winning Storyteller | Director | Artist working with emerging new media. She was the Creative Producer | Founding Member of The Skin Deep, an award-winning creative studio in Brooklyn, where she directed and produced series such as {THE AND}, The Dig, Senior Orientation, The Window, and more. Her work has been screened at festivals around the world, such as Cannes, Tribeca, Sundance, IDFA, Declass, Aspen Shorts, and more. Julia is also a passionate performer, traveler, and dance lover. | www.juliagorbach.com

Gabriel Dudin 

Gabriel is a New York City student and creator, majoring in Media Studies at Hunter College. Specializing in film/videography, design, and social media, he loves the art of storytelling and the creation process from beginning to end. He will be bringing a young and fresh perspective on both The Smile Experiment and Dance for Life projects. He will also be recapping everyday in video form!

Risks & Challenges

The $15,000 goal will only be enough to cover our travel (car rental, gas, flights back, meals, lodging, etc.), crew, equipment rental, and the backer rewards. In order for us to have Professional Post-Production, we will need to hire professional video editors. That is why we have a stretch goal of $25,000 to help pay for the footage to be put together professionally.

As we are already en route, this project is already live and happening. There is no backing out now. (We trust that if the world believes in backing a potato salad to the tune of $55,000 (seriously), they will believe in backing our mission of spreading love through dance.) As a backer, you will NOT be disappointed with a canceled project, because whether or not we hit our goal, this is already happening! The only risk is that if we do not meet our post-production goal of $25,000, the Dance for Life project will take longer to produce, as we will have to generate funding for post-production.

So the only risk is on my own wallet, as I am currently paying for everything out of pocket. But we are confident that you will understand the impact we will be making and help us make this into a reality faster.

There is a countless number of stories to tell! (And NO, I am not paying myself anything. Just my crew. I get paid in people's smiles when I dance with them. And in the people we influence to dance!)Okay, but what will I get if I contribute?Through The Smile Experiment and the Dance for Life series, you will help show thousands, if not millions, of people the JOY AND POWER OF DANCE! But for real, you will also get rewarded for your good karma. Check out the perks we are offering below. You can also see them to the right.If you are a dancer, dance coach, studio owner, dancetrepeneur, or just simply a dance lover, you cannot not miss this opportunity to back this project and get the country, and world, dancing more! We really hope you will contribute to our campaign and become a DuDancer*!*DuDancer - one who believes in the joy and power of dance and shares it PERKSPledge $10 - Become a DuDancer!Part of Thank You Video. We'll create a “Thank You” video listing the names of all the contributors to the backdrop of the people we dance with on this trip.Download of The Smile Experiment Cross Country Video. We’ll send you a high resolution file of the finished video of The Smile Experiment - Cross Country. If you want to share the joy and power of dance with anyone, you’ll be able to without any copyright on our end. Pledge $20 - Become a Super DuDancer!Custom postcard from the trip. We will be creating custom post cards for every major city/landmark that we visit.Plus everything in the $10 tier.Pledge $50 - Become a Super Trendy DuDancer! “Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” T-Shirt. Stand out in the crowd and show everyone how much you love dance with a “Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” T-Shirt! Get it in Black or White.Plus everything in the $20 tier.Pledge $75 - Become a Super Duper DuDancer!Set of 6 custom postcards from the trip. Start your Custom DuDance postcard collection early!Plus everything in the $50 tier.Pledge $125 - Become a Super Duper Trendy DuDancer!“Spread Love it’s the DuDance Way” Hoodie. Show how much you love DuDancing, all whilst staying warm and trendy.Plus everything in the $75 tier.Pledge $250 - Become a Caring DuDancer!Custom Message Posted on our Facebook Page. Perfect for those who love dance, or who want their dance related brand to be seen by 22K dance lovers. We will create a personal video shoutout thanking you (or your brand/organization) and will post it on our FB page! (One of our videos reached over 4 million views!)Plus everything in the $125 tier.Pledge $500 - Become a Savvy DuDancer!Promote your brand with us! If you’re a dance studio owner or sell dance related products/services, you cannot miss this opportunity to promote your brand via the DuDance network. We will share any 4 posts/videos/photos with our 22K followers on FB; all of whom LOVE dancing! This is on top of receiving a personalized video shoutout posted directly on our page. Plus everything in the $250 tier.Pledge $2500 - Become a DuDancer Producer!Become a Producer! Get Producer credits for all first 8 episodes of the Dance for Life series! Your funding will help influence thousands of people to improve their lives through dance. Grow your name's brand (or brand's name) with Producer credits.Plus everything in the $500 tier.Pledge $7500 - Become an Executive DuDancer!Become an Executive Producer! Get Executive Producer credits for all 8 episodes of the Dance for Life series! Your funding will help with the post production of this web series and help build your name's brand (or brand's name), depends on if you fund personally or for your organization.Plus everything in the $500 tier.Meet the TeamArkadiy StepanchukArkadiy loves dancing and he most definitely does not hide it. Being a professionally trained ballroom dancer for over a decade, he now trains students of all backgrounds. From autistic children to Senior Citizens, he uses the DuDance platform to show that anyone can, and should, dance! Julia GorbachJulia is an Emmy award-winning Storyteller | Director | Artist working with emerging new media. She was the Creative Producer | Founding Member of The Skin Deep, an award-winning creative studio in Brooklyn, where she directed and produced series such as {THE AND}, The Dig, Senior Orientation, The Window, and more. Her work has been screened at festivals around the world, such as Cannes, Tribeca, Sundance, IDFA, Declass, Aspen Shorts, and more. Julia is also a passionate performer, traveler, and dance lover. | www.juliagorbach.comGabriel Dudin Gabriel is a New York City student and creator, majoring in Media Studies at Hunter College. Specializing in film/videography, design, and social media, he loves the art of storytelling and the creation process from beginning to end. He will be bringing a young and fresh perspective on both The Smile Experiment and Dance for Life projects. He will also be recapping everyday in video form!Risks & ChallengesThe $15,000 goal will only be enough to cover our travel (car rental, gas, flights back, meals, lodging, etc.), crew, equipment rental, and the backer rewards. In order for us to have Professional Post-Production, we will need to hire professional video editors. That is why we have a stretch goal of $25,000 to help pay for the footage to be put together professionally.As we are already en route, this project is already live and happening. There is no backing out now. (We trust that if the world believes in backing a potato salad to the tune of $55,000 (seriously), they will believe in backing our mission of spreading love through dance.) As a backer, you will NOT be disappointed with a canceled project, because whether or not we hit our goal, this is already happening! The only risk is that if we do not meet our post-production goal of $25,000, the Dance for Life project will take longer to produce, as we will have to generate funding for post-production.So the only risk is on my own wallet, as I am currently paying for everything out of pocket. But we are confident that you will understand the impact we will be making and help us make this into a reality faster.

story:
Ezekiel Theater Company

Ezekiel Theater Company, as a professional Christian theater company, was founded by theater professionals and actors who have been active for decades in their respective fields with the purpose of “expanding the audience from Christians to the general public.” Ezekiel has been pursuing ‘the art of life – the art of the people who have been infused with the life of God through Jesus’ since its inception.:

  • The Ezekiel Drama Ministry is a constantly growing organization that has exponentially increased in audience number as more performances are made.
  • Audiences and critics raved about many of our plays which have attracted over 24,000 viewers*.
  • Almost 80% of Ezekiel’s stage performances* have been sold out early.
  • Our performance record is one of the best when it comes to LA Korean stage performances and we make sure that our plays are accessible to English and Korean speakers alike.
  • Our theater company sponsors many non-profit organizations for charity while providing a medium for audiences to learn about the gospel.

  • In general, the group of theatergoers we attract are ones who are very open to our experimental performances as well as what we advertise.

*77 performances in the span of 4 years
 

극단 이즈키엘은 전문 기독교 공연예술 단체으로서 각 분야에서 활동하고 있는 문화, 예술, 연극 전문가들과 전문 배우들이 “관객을 성도에서 일반인으로 확대시키자”라는 취지를 가지고  “생명의 예술 – 예수님을 통해 하나님의 생명이 불어 넣어진 자들이 전하는 예술”을 수많은 성도와 일반인 관객에게 선보이고 있습니다.

  • 극단 이즈키엘은 공연이 늘어남에 따라 잠재 고객 수가 기하 급수적으로 증가하는 지속적으로 성장하는 극단입니다.
  • 총 77 개 무대 공연 중 약 80 %가 조기에 매진되었으며 공연의 기록은 LA 한인 무대 공연의 최고 기록 중 하나입니다.
  • 저희는 많은 비영리 단체를 후원하고 관객에게 복음에 관해 배울 수있는 매체를 제공합니다.
  • 이민 1.5세가 운영, 영어와 한국어 계  모두에게 접근 할 수 있는 장점이 있으며 공연 또한 영어 자막을 써서 많은 관객들에게 어필할수 있습니다.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

금전적으로 도우실수 없다면 페이스북 공유를 이용하셔서 저희의 이야기를 많이 알려주세요. 부탁드립니다.

The Cast

Visit our Facebook page for more photos! 
https://www.facebook.com/ezekieldramaministry/

story:
As theatre artists, we have found a welcoming and warm home here at Bard College, and especially in the student-run theatrical space, The Old Gym. The annual Halloween show was the first piece we were involved in at Bard, and to be producing it now and carrying on this time honored tradition is a true thrill. We have amassed a company of passionate artists, all focused on creating a memorable, meaningful, and fun experience for the Bard community. We are driven and deeply motivated by our desire to produce the highest quality production as possible. This year, our student directors are devising adaptations of Hansel and Gretel, Snow White, The Little Mermaid, Little Red Riding Hood, Rumpelstiltskin, and Peter Pan and his Shadow. 

 

Currently we are raising money to pay for the materials necessary to mount the production. The money we raise will enable us to buy the following:

Curtains (necessary to build the individual rooms which the adaptations will take place in)

Costumes.

Make-up.

Crucial building supplies (nails, tools, paint).

Props.

All of the money we raise will be spent go towards buying necessary supplies for the show. Without the help of donations, we simply do not have the resources to see this show through. Any and all donations are extremely appreciated. 

 

Please feel free to spread the word about Grimm Haus as well! We will premier October 27th and 28th in the Old Gym!

story:
Ο στόχος μας είναι 3000 ευρώ τα οποία θα καλύψουν:

μέρος των εξόδων ενοικίασης του θεάτρου

μέρος των εξόδων παραγωγής

σκηνικά & κοστούμια

μέρος πληρωμών των συντελεστών.

Όλο το εγχείρημα μας βασίζεται στην αγάπη μας για το θέατρο και στον ενθουσιασμό που έδειξε η ομάδα των συντελεστών διαβάζοντας το κείμενο. Δυστυχώς δεν έχουμε παραγωγή γι αυτό αποφασίσαμε να χρησιμοποιήσουμε αυτό τον τρόπο ώστε να δημιουργήσουμε την ιδανική για μας παράσταση. Η παράσταση έχει σκοπό να σας διασκεδάσει κ ενδεχομένως να σας προβληματίσει και λίγο. Είναι πολύ σημαντικό για εμάς, που είμαστε ΅νέοι καλλιτέχνες΅ να έχουμε την βοήθεια σας και να γίνεται μέρος της ομάδας! 

Οι συντελεστές της παράστασης: 

Σκηνοθεσία: Μαργαρίτα Αμαραντίδη 

Κείμενο: Δώρα Πανταζοπούλου 

Σκηνικά-Κοστούμια: Εμμανουέλα Αλφιέρη 

Επιμελεια κίνησης: Στρατός Λύκος 

Μουσική-Βοηθός σκηνοθέτη: Βαλίσια Βύζα 

Παίζουν: Γιάννης Παπαευθυμίου , Δώρα Πανταζοπούλου 

Θέατρο Μπίπ από 15 Μαρτίου 2018

 

Our goal is 3000 euros which will cover:    

part of the theater rental costs    

part of production costs     

props & costumes    

part of crew payment.

Our project is based on our love for the theater and the enthusiasm that all of the team showed towards this. Unfortunately we do not have a producer, so we decided to use this way in order for us to find the budget to make this theatrical perfect!  As a group of young artists, it is really important to contribute in this project and we will be very happy for you to become a member of the team.

Crew 

Director: Margarita Amarantidi

Theatrical Script: Dora Pantazopoulou

Music-Director assistant: Valicia Vyza

Costumes - Scenography: Emmanouela Alfieri

Actors: John Papaefthimiou , Dora Pantazopoulou

story:
About us

Meet Alpha Female, an artist baring her soul in a tumultuous ride of sex, booze, drugs and rock and roll and everything that comes with that chaotic journey toward self-reliance and self-integration.  She, her multiple personalities, and her band of hard-rockin’ misfits tell it like it is in this rough, raw soliloquy of sound while exploring contemporary issues like mental illness, substance abuse, compromise, exploitation, and the failed relationships along the way, ultimately seeking redemption of spirit through the power of music.   The show explores a number of issues, including mental issues, women's empowerment, the damage caused by abuse and stereotyping and the artist's struggle to conquer them all.

 

More info

Coming to the Acorn Theater on Theater Row in NYC in July, Bad Ass Beauty: The Rock Opera will present 5 performances and must raise the funds to do so

What does NYMF pay for?


NYMF provides a framework to allow the shows to be produced much less expensively, and we take care of the big-ticket items – the performance venue and venue staff, the major marketing, a generous lighting package and major overall technical support.

​

NYMF spends about $30,000 per show to provide a package of resources and services (which would cost much more for an individual, independent production). These resources include:

  • An Off-Broadway theater in which to perform your show, equipped with an extensive lighting and sound plot
  • A band package including keyboard or piano, drums, guitar and bass amps, music stands, chairs, etc.
  • Wireless microphones and instrument microphones, and all the perishable equipment needed to use them
  • A sound engineer (A1) to mix your show  and deck sound assistant (A2) to help with wireless microphones
  • Tape, gel, and other incidental tech needs, as well as a steamer or iron for wardrobe
  • A technician, production manager, box office management, and house management in each venue
  • Marketing assistance through the NYMF website, Festival-wide materials and advertising, Festival press/media outreach, and promotional events
  • Access to NYMF-specific discounts on rehearsal space, costumes, and other equipment, and on outside marketing and printing for your NYMF production 

 

We cover the rest.We currently have musicians who have done extensive work on Broadway and are excited to work on this project.  This initial $30,000 (a little more than half of our actual budget) will ensure we lock down a great General Manager who will take care of all financial dealings.  It will also help pay for our musicians' and actors' initial rehearsals -- transportation and compensation for their time as well as the remaining festival submission fee, due April 30th.  It will also cover legal fees,  promo shots, the cost of liability insurance and audition expenses (casting director for Equity auditions and studio rental.)  Our cast and crew are made up of professional people with loads of experience (see their bios on http://www.badassbeautymusical.com) so that we can put on a professional level show in the largest musical festival in the world!   

     

    The Impact

    • Our show addresses issues of women's empowerment and the struggle of females everywhere.  Why do intelligent females put themselves down supporting everyone else but themselves?  Why are women discarded as we reach middle age due to ageism and discrimination?  How do women overcome the stereotypes that society has created about our roles in our chosen field?  How do we overcome these issues?  This show addresses these issues  set to fantastic, driving rock songs and a singer who blows the roof off the house!  The show is sexy, funny, bold and timely.  It is for mature audiences.
    • All of the people involved so far believe in this project.  I never expected to be selected and truly believe we will raise the money and reach our goals
    • I have specific goals.  All of the musicians involved and I have paid our dues and pounded the payment dreaming of earning our livings touring and making music.  My goal is to do just that -- tour the world with this musical while encouraging not only women, but folks of all ages along the way.  And of course, entertaining.

     

    Risks & Challenges

    • Our first hurdle, submission fee of $3,500 out of $6,000 has been overcome.  Now, our hurdle is to retain our General Manager who has extensive experience with NYMF and an attorney to work out the Collaboration Agreement amongst the parties. 

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    • Make some noise about our campaign, our facebook page, our website.  Share with your friends!
    • We are seeking a social media intern.  Are you great at Twitter, Instagram and Facebook or know anyone who is?  Please send them our way!
    • Are you in NYC?  We could use volunteers to help build our set!  We could use hands helping to haul equipment into and out of the venue!  If you have a van, we could use it to transport. 
    • Please volunteer to street team, handing out flyers and hanging posters once our dates are announced on April 27th.  Anything else you can think of?  Run it by us!
    • We are seeking female owned business owners who would like to support the arts.  If you know of anyone, pass them our way.
    • We are seeking patrons of the arts, specifically those who support new musical theater endeavors.  If you know of anyone, send them our way!
    • Any connections to press or ROCK radio?  Please send them our way.

     

    About the New York Musical Festival

    The New York Musical Festival nurtures the creation, production, and public presentation of stylistically, thematically, and culturally diverse new musicals to ensure the future vitality of musical theater.

    Now in its fifteenth year, the Festival is the premier musical theater event in the world. The preeminent site for launching new musicals and discovering new talent, the Festival provides an affordable platform for artists to mount professional productions that reach their peers, industry leaders, and musical theater fans. More than 90 Festival shows have gone on to productions on and Off-Broadway, in regional theaters in all 50 states, and in more than 24 countries worldwide. Festival alumni have received a wide array of awards including the Tony Award® and the Pulitzer Prize. In 2013, NYMF received a special Drama Desk Award in recognition of its work "creating and nurturing new musical theater, ensuring the future of this essential art form."

    NYMF is the flagship program of National Music Theater Network, Inc., a 501(c) (3) not-for-profit organization. 2018 NYMF is sponsored by The City of New York Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment, PRG, TheaterMania, Clear Channel Outdoor, Tinc Productions and Fox Stage Productions and is supported, in part, by an award from the National Endowment for the Arts, and by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs.

    The NYMF PASS is a great way to experience The New York Musical Festival. With a NYMF PASS, you can get into the theater before individual ticket holders. Passes also offer the exclusive ability to book tickets before they go on sale to the public. Individual tickets on sale now.

    The 2018 New York Musical Festival will take place July 9th - August 5th. For more information, please visit: http://www.nymf.org

    Thank you so much for reading and for your generous donation!!

​
NYMF spends about $30,000 per show to provide a package of resources and services (which would cost much more for an individual, independent production). These resources include:

An Off-Broadway theater in which to perform your show, equipped with an extensive lighting and sound plot
A band package including keyboard or piano, drums, guitar and bass amps, music stands, chairs, etc.
Wireless microphones and instrument microphones, and all the perishable equipment needed to use them
A sound engineer (A1) to mix your show  and deck sound assistant (A2) to help with wireless microphones
Tape, gel, and other incidental tech needs, as well as a steamer or iron for wardrobe
A technician, production manager, box office management, and house management in each venue
Marketing assistance through the NYMF website, Festival-wide materials and advertising, Festival press/media outreach, and promotional events
Access to NYMF-specific discounts on rehearsal space, costumes, and other equipment, and on outside marketing and printing for your NYMF production 

 
We cover the rest.We currently have musicians who have done extensive work on Broadway and are excited to work on this project.  This initial $30,000 (a little more than half of our actual budget) will ensure we lock down a great General Manager who will take care of all financial dealings.  It will also help pay for our musicians' and actors' initial rehearsals -- transportation and compensation for their time as well as the remaining festival submission fee, due April 30th.  It will also cover legal fees,  promo shots, the cost of liability insurance and audition expenses (casting director for Equity auditions and studio rental.)  Our cast and crew are made up of professional people with loads of experience (see their bios on http://www.badassbeautymusical.com) so that we can put on a professional level show in the largest musical festival in the world!   


 
The Impact

Our show addresses issues of women's empowerment and the struggle of females everywhere.  Why do intelligent females put themselves down supporting everyone else but themselves?  Why are women discarded as we reach middle age due to ageism and discrimination?  How do women overcome the stereotypes that society has created about our roles in our chosen field?  How do we overcome these issues?  This show addresses these issues  set to fantastic, driving rock songs and a singer who blows the roof off the house!  The show is sexy, funny, bold and timely.  It is for mature audiences.
All of the people involved so far believe in this project.  I never expected to be selected and truly believe we will raise the money and reach our goals
I have specific goals.  All of the musicians involved and I have paid our dues and pounded the payment dreaming of earning our livings touring and making music.  My goal is to do just that -- tour the world with this musical while encouraging not only women, but folks of all ages along the way.  And of course, entertaining.


 
Risks & Challenges
Our first hurdle, submission fee of $3,500 out of $6,000 has been overcome.  Now, our hurdle is to retain our General Manager who has extensive experience with NYMF and an attorney to work out the Collaboration Agreement amongst the parties. 

 
Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise about our campaign, our facebook page, our website.  Share with your friends!
We are seeking a social media intern.  Are you great at Twitter, Instagram and Facebook or know anyone who is?  Please send them our way!
Are you in NYC?  We could use volunteers to help build our set!  We could use hands helping to haul equipment into and out of the venue!  If you have a van, we could use it to transport. 
Please volunteer to street team, handing out flyers and hanging posters once our dates are announced on April 27th.  Anything else you can think of?  Run it by us!
We are seeking female owned business owners who would like to support the arts.  If you know of anyone, pass them our way.
We are seeking patrons of the arts, specifically those who support new musical theater endeavors.  If you know of anyone, send them our way!
Any connections to press or ROCK radio?  Please send them our way.

 
About the New York Musical Festival
The New York Musical Festival nurtures the creation, production, and public presentation of stylistically, thematically, and culturally diverse new musicals to ensure the future vitality of musical theater.
Now in its fifteenth year, the Festival is the premier musical theater event in the world. The preeminent site for launching new musicals and discovering new talent, the Festival provides an affordable platform for artists to mount professional productions that reach their peers, industry leaders, and musical theater fans. More than 90 Festival shows have gone on to productions on and Off-Broadway, in regional theaters in all 50 states, and in more than 24 countries worldwide. Festival alumni have received a wide array of awards including the Tony Award® and the Pulitzer Prize. In 2013, NYMF received a special Drama Desk Award in recognition of its work "creating and nurturing new musical theater, ensuring the future of this essential art form."
NYMF is the flagship program of National Music Theater Network, Inc., a 501(c) (3) not-for-profit organization. 2018 NYMF is sponsored by The City of New York Mayor's Office of Media and Entertainment, PRG, TheaterMania, Clear Channel Outdoor, Tinc Productions and Fox Stage Productions and is supported, in part, by an award from the National Endowment for the Arts, and by public funds from the New York City Department of Cultural Affairs.
The NYMF PASS is a great way to experience The New York Musical Festival. With a NYMF PASS, you can get into the theater before individual ticket holders. Passes also offer the exclusive ability to book tickets before they go on sale to the public. Individual tickets on sale now.
The 2018 New York Musical Festival will take place July 9th - August 5th. For more information, please visit: http://www.nymf.org
Thank you so much for reading and for your generous donation!!

story:
A Message from our Director

One thing that really attracted me to Gracie was the way in which it gives centre-stage to a working class woman who exists within the margins of society.This is one of the many factors that makes Gracie a unique play and is also something which personally resonates with me as a female director from a working class background. Across the industry, there is a dearth of stories and decision makers from my background. I find this curious and saddening, yet it fuels me to be at the forefront of this change. Gracie is a play that champions the tenacity of the human spirit; I hope Gracie's story will empower girls, women and feminists who join us on her journey.

About Our Project

Gracie was born into a polygamous religious community, and brought across the US border to Canada at the age of eight. A lively and irrepressible child, her world is full of faith and family, but by the time she is fifteen, and at marriageable age, she feels increasing pressure to conform…but will she dare to take the leap and step into the outside world? A gripping and life-affirming story about growing up in a religious cult by Joan MacLeod, winner of Canada’s most prestigious literary award, the Governor General’s Award.This play is a work of fiction inspired by the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints (FLDS) communities in Canada and the U.S.

It is important to us that we engage with the theme of violence against women and children presented within the play at a grass roots level. After performances we will be collecting donations for our partner charity Refuge, the country's largest provider of specialist services for women and children escaping domestic violence.

We Need Your Help

Performing theatre in London in an off west-end context can be costly and risky with many shows making a loss or only breaking even (just about!). We are excited to be bringing the European premiere of Gracie to the Finborough Theatre but this comes with its own risks and costs particularly as we are committed to paying our actor properly. We have an exceptional team of young creatives, all with brilliant careers ahead of them. Your support will not only make a difference to the success of this show but also their ability to create and perform work in the future. The company is entirely self-funded. Without support and fundraising we will struggle to continue to have future showcases and to present new works.

We are seeking to raise £1200 to help us deliver our vision for this powerful play about family, faith and freedom.

Set Purchase and Construction: £500

Rehearsal Space: £400

Photography: £100

Dialect Coaching: £100

Lighting Purchase: £100 

Meet the Cast

Carla Langley  plays Gracie. Theatre includes The Ferryman (Royal Court Theatre and Gielgud Theatre, Winner of Best New Play Olivier Awards 2018), Orca (Southwark Playhouse), Future Conditional (The Old Vic), Cuddles for which she won the Manchester Theatre Award for Best Studio Performance (Studio at Royal Exchange Theatre, Manchester, 59E59 Theaters, New York City, Ovalhouse and National Tour), The Minotaur (Polka Theatre and Clwyd Theatr Cymru), Liola (National Theatre), Desolate Heaven (Theatre 503), The Three Lives of Lucie Cabrol (Edinburgh Festival) and As You Like It (Sam Wanamaker Festival at Shakespeare’s Globe). Television includes Witness For The Prosecution and Penny Dreadful. Radio includes Fury.

Meet the Director

Director Gemma Aked-Priestley has directed The Narcissist (Hen and Chickens Theatre for Flux Theatre), Grimm: An Untold Tale (Underbelly at Edinburgh Festival) and Tender Napalm (Karamel Club). Assistant Direction includes assisting Sam Hodges on the world premiere of Howard Brenton’s The Shadow Factory (Nuffield Southampton Theatres), Daniel Goldman on Thebes Land (Arcola Theatre), David Mercatali on Tonight With Donny Stixx (Bunker Theatre) and Matt Cowart on Lockhart (Bernie Grant Arts Centre). Gemma is currently developing Passing with playwright Indigo Griffiths, with support from the Arts Council England, Nuffield Southampton Theatres, Bunker Theatre and Women@RADA. She is the Assistant Director for The Mono Box and founder of PLAYSTART. Gemma supported director Katie Henry as a Casting Assistant on the National Theatre’s revival of War Horse and was subsequently invited to shadow rehearsals in London and Canterbury. She studied at the University of East Anglia and trained at Mountview Academy of Theatre Arts. She is the recipient of bursaries from the Mayflower Theatre, Yorkshire Ladies Council of Education, Barker-Mill Foundation and the JMK Trust.

Creative Team

Writer: Joan MacLeod

Director: Gemma Aked-Priestley

Creative Producer: Alex Brown

Set & Costume Designer: Bex Kemp

Sound Designer: Sam Glossop

Lighting Designer: Ali Hunter

Movement Director: Nicky Griffiths

Assistant Director: Mingyu Lin

Dialect Coach: Jacquie Crago

Head of Publicity: Emily Souders

Every single ounce of support, however big or small, will be pivotal in helping us bring the show to life.

If you aren’t donating today, then please support us by spreading the word about our show and our campaign as we would love to share the work with as many people as possible. Tweet about us @GraciePlay1, Like our Facebook Page: Gracie by Joan MacLeod, and click attending on our Facebook Event: Gracie.

We hope that we have inspired you in some way to support Gracie.

Warmest wishes,

The Gracie Team X

story:
Native from France, I started bellydancing at age 17. After having explored, ballet, rythmic gymnastic and contemporary dance, I found my calling with the art of Middle Eastern dancing also called "Danse Orientale". I was part of the troupe "Les Princesses de l'Orient" in Nice directed by master teacher and choreographer Sandra, and then "The Oriental Jewels" directed by the amazing Talia in San Diego. I am now performing solo and have been teaching since 2005. I have more than 20 years of experience in Bellydancing. In addition, after a few years of practicing aerial hoop and silks, I discovered Pole Dancing and fell madly in love with it! I have been training hard at Emerald City Trapeze in Seattle and other studios, as well as my home, to be able to perform and for the last year I have been working on completing a teacher certification with Pole and Aerial.com.  I am also a 500h ERYTT Yoga Instructor with over 12 years of experience, and my classes will never miss to challenge you and bring you complete BLISS!

I now became the business owner of "Dance Expression & Yoga Flow"  and decided to open a Pole dance and fitness studio, (it will be so much better than doing this out of my home!) which will include also Bellydancing. I will have classes every day for beginners and all levels. Pole classes will include : Intro to pole, Spins, transitions and floorwork, climb and inversions, and pole fitness (for strength and flexibility). I will also be hosting workshops and teaching for Bachelorette parties. I bought 5 poles that had to be custom made because of the high height of the ceiling, I still need to buy crash pads, the insurance, cover the cost of advertising and the first couple of months of rent.  I did not get a bank loan, I am a single mom doing it all on my own with no financial support, and I had to use the last of my savings so far. My only plan is to make my studio very successful, and believing that it will all pay for itself in the end. Getting funds will be incredibly helpful in order to get everything the studio needs to make it successful and ready to get going!! 

Grand opening is planned for January 2snd.

The main challenge of this project will be to not have enough students, that is why I would like to cover the cost of the rent rent of space for the first 2 months so I can have peace of mind and time to build up clientele.

Please spread the word, share this campaign, come to my class, first class will be free, experience the joy of dancing and the amazing workout and benefits (physical, emotional and mental) it provides!

story:
The Producing Team of Untold Stories, Shellen Lubin, Susan Merson and Beth-Ellen Keyes, have between them more than 120 years of experience in creation, performance, direction and arts management,  They are passionate about these stories of Jewish women, and have carefully chosen works from a large group of outstanding playwrights, poets, and performers.  There are pieces about scientists, revolutionaries, survivors, and artists of all kinds.  These stories, both familiar and not, reveal a compelling cultural history which must be seen.  

We have priced our tickets at ​a​ purposely​ low ​rate​ ($25 for the entire festival/$10 per day) to make the event accessible to all ages, cultural backgrounds, and economic strata. ​  The Team is actively reaching out to religious schools, senior centers and other organizations who we know would enjoy the performances, and we are offering blocks of tickets at reduced prices or pro bono.​

Our full ​schedule can be found here:  www.womenartsmedia.org/untold

​

story:
Who is Chris Tsujiuchi?

"Toronto's newest Cabaret sensation" - Xtra!

"Superstar" - twisitheatreblog.com

"Nothing is ever quite as entertaining as a Chris-terical Cabaret." - myentertainmentworld.ca

"Hot in the bum area." - Sharron Matthews (Canada Sings)

"Ridiculously talented." -Thom Alison (CBC's Over the Rainbow)

"[A] talented accompanist, musical director and possessor of one of the finest manes in the city, Tsujiuchi is also one of our finest cabaret artists – as he shows in his regular series of holiday cabarets." - Glenn Sumi, NOW Magazine

What is "A Very Chris-terical Christmas Cabaret"?

For many people in Toronto, this Christmas Cabaret has become an annual tradition; a tradition it has become harder each year to get tickets to before they sell out! This show has been thriving for the last 9 years at Buddies in Bad Times Theatre - the longest running and largest queer theatre in the world - and has been selling out for the past 5 years.  It feels like the right time, not only because it's the 10th anniversary, but also in light of all the dialogue these days about representation and visibility that this show should move to a bigger venue. This story deserves to be seen and heard by a much larger, broader audience.  If you contribute, you will be supporting a self-produced gay artist of colour enter mainstream visibility in Toronto from the periphery. 

Also, the Christmas Cabaret needs a corresponding Christmas Album, so with you're help, we'll be recording that too. (an album you can have to keep in some form if you donate to this campaign at any level!)

What We Need & What You Get

$10,000 to cover the cost of recording "A Very Chris-terical Christmas Album"

     - In-studio recording time (approx. $500/day for 4 days, not including musicians' fees)

     - Mixing (approx $3000)

    - Mastering (approx $1500)

    - Musicians' Fees (paying all the people on the album; approx. $150 per person per song)

    - Rehearsal time, and rehearsal space

$15,000 to rent a bigger theatre, ideally the CAA Theatre (formerly the Panasonic Theatre).

    - this is just the rental cost, and does not include: paying the performers, technicians,

       production costs, sets, costumes, etc.

What you get: In addition to the perks listed on the right, everyone who contributes to this campaign at any level will receive a "thank you" in the Christmas Cabaret's program / playbill, unless you wish to remain anonymous.

The Impact

Cabaret is not a tried tested and true format for selling out big theatres, and so this is the type of show that would probably never find its way into the Mirvish's subscription season, but it is deserving of this kind of platform. Putting Chris Tsujiuchi and his band of merry musicians in a position to be seen and enjoyed by a much larger and broader group of people, in 2018 seems like the next logical step. (Not to mention that he'll finally be able to fulfill his lifelong dream of flying over the audience.)

Risks & Challenges

A homegrown cabaret on this large of a scale is highly unprecedented in Canada. So no, it's never been done before.  But if there's one person who's going to make it happen, it's Chris Tsujiuchi.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to contributing to / sharing this crowdfunding campaign. Chris Tsujiuchi and his production team will be looking for corporate sponsors to cover the production costs, the cost of the band, the sets, costumes, lighting, staff at the theatre, etc. You can help by sharing this campaign, or if you know someone who works for, or runs/owns a company that would be interested in sponsoring this year's cabaret, please don't hesitate to send along their contact info, so we can set up a meeting, or send along an e-mailable sponsorship kit.

story:
There is no greater thing than standing victorious in the arena.

The DC Stunt Coalition (DCSC) has been hired by Red Serpents, LLC. to perform the official live action gladiator fights for the first official U.S. Spartacus-themed fan convention, Spartacon.

 

For the last 4 months, DCSC has been working towards creating the single greatest gladiatorial combat show ever hosted in Maryland. It has been a challenging road, requiring all of us to sacrifice time, money, and give up all things cake-like in order to become the Champions you'll be seeing on August 15th and 16th at the Waldorf Arena.

We need your help to show appreciation to this marvelous collection of incredibly talented stunt performers and action actors as they give blood, sweat, and tears upon the sands for your entertainment.

We've already performed incredibly well-received and successful shows at MAGFest, AwesomeCon, and Otakon. Spartacon is our next stop on the road to glory!
 

This campaign is being produced in an effort to support our cast, give the audience a chance to interact with us in some very unique and awesome ways, all to insure our excitement and inspiration when producing future shows. If you can offer us your patronage, not only will we reward you with special tribute items, but we'll also shout out your name in the arena, in front of thousands of fans and even the original cast of the hit Starz television series, Spartacus.



By giving us your support this time around, you're insuring not only the success of this performance, but helping to fund future performances from the DC Stunt Coalition by showing that there is in fact an audience for these kind of bad-ass, non-stop action spectaculars for all fandoms and genres.
 


This will be the first show of it's kind, will only be performed one time, and we're hoping that with your appreciation, it won't be the last!

Help Our Ludus! Become a patron of our gladiators, and join us in glory upon the sands!

The DC Stunt Coalition (DCSC) is aiming to raise just $2,000 to go towards paying our production crew and the cast a fair reimbursement their hard work and long hours spent putting this show together.



Every performer has purchased at least one personal training weapon (a Cold Steel training gladius valued at $22), as well as costume stunt shoes ($26 a pair), and paid 3 months of dues towards DC Stunt Coalition in order to afford training space and time ($60 per person). We want to do our best to reimburse our gladiators for these training costs.

 

These costs, on top of travel expenses to multiple weekly training sessions (locations sponsored by Hwarang Martial Arts and Tough Temple Crossfit), and the extra costs of staying on a healthy, fuel-filled diet to stay in shape for the event, has all been put towards one goal: Providing you with the best show possible, made up of the DC area's BEST gladiators available.

 

Anything we can profit on will also go towards the DC Stunt Coalition coffers - the publicity from this campaign, as well as your continued support and patronage, will help us to make bigger, better shows in the future. Not just for Spartacon, but for MAGFest, Otakon, AwesomeCon, and more. This year we were invited to ConBravo, OmegaCon, Otakon and A Video Game Con. We'd love to perform at all of these events, but without a source of crowd funds, we can't afford to do all of them! Help us take our show on the road.

 

Funds from this campaign will also go towards producing OFFICIAL DC Stunt Coalition Gladiator T-shirts, tank tops, and photo cards (to be signed at SPARTACON), so that we can better promote our brand at the event, and allow for a more interactive connection with our fan base. We want to make you guys a part of the action!

 

Your donations will allow us to spend time at the event meeting-and-greeting with you, the fans, by providing us with better accoutrements to our Ludus Suite.

Even if we can't reach our entire goal, we'll be splitting what we raise between our production crew, as well as putting it towards providing the above mentioned perks to the fans. More than anything, we want YOU, the audience, to be a part of this show, whether that means wearing our colors with our bad ass, Spartacus: Blood and Sand inspired T-shirt, or by taking home a signed photo post card featuring our own gladiators in their incredible costumes.

Finally, should we receive all requested funding, we'll be recording the fights, and creating a post-convention documentary from interviews, footage, and a pilot episode of a webseries, "Road to the Arena"

 

 

 

    "Nothing in this world is impossible when heart and mind are put towards it!"

    Fight shows like these give members of the Coalition an opportunity to sharpen their skills immensely with a specific goal over a short period of time. Training is intense, and requires a lot of sacrifices on the part of the performers and crew.

     

    Over the course of this production, members have learned Sword and Shield, Single Sword, Filipino Martial Arts techniques, performed HIIT workouts, and a lot of Cross-Fit styled conditioning.  JB Jaeger of MD Jeet Kune Do has been helping us with specialized martial arts training for double-sword action for the last month, and has joined DCSC as a guest instructor. We even hosted a workshop with Jason Croom of FMA Action Club, an instructor from ACT TACTICAL For Film in Atlanta, Georgia. Training for a show like this not only strengthens the individual performers, but helps our group to bond as a team and motivate future productions.

     

    We have performed 5 live fight shows at conventions, including our massively successful, hour long show, The Legend of Zelda: Gamers Against the Grimdark at MAGFest 13. The audience of 1,400 fans gave us a standing ovation, and positive reviews and a demand for a new show have been a significant portion of the MAGFest official feedback form results. We've even been invited back to perform at MAGClassic as well as MAGFest 2016.

     

    Our members train every weekend in the hopes that one day they'll be professional Hollywood stunt performers, theatrical stage combatants, or notable action actors. For many, this is just a first step towards achieving a career in the entertainment profession.
     

    Your support helps them to push themselves to the limit in the pursuit of this goal.

     

      "A man must accept his fate, or be destroyed by it."

       

      Spartacon has offered us a starter budget to create many of the elements you'll see in the show - Costumes, weapons, and props.  But, as this is a first time convention, The Red Serpents cannot afford to hire our gladiators individually, or the crew to help run all the support necessary to create the production.

      We have an experienced and dedicated crew working behind the scenes to make this show happen:

       

      Our costume designer, Rachel, has already put in over 100 hours of unpaid time to create 15 unique, genuine leather-and-rivet Gladiator costumes - including tributes to Spartacus, Crixus, and the Shadow of Death himself, Theokolese! Our in-house videographer Brett has shot over 10 hours of footage to document our training sessions. Our director Dylan Hintz, on top of countless hours spent managing the production, organizing training sessions, and sacrificing other paid gigs to perform at Spartacon, has worked with Destroyer Modz to create custom weapons, shields, and props for the show. Tom Hyre, the director of the Panels Department at MAGFest, has also contributed his time and energy towards the production of the show's narrative and historical elements.

       

      None of the above crew members have used the provided budget to fill their own purses with coin. Spartacon's Live Gladiator Stunt Show has been a passion project, but it's required a full summer of sacrifices for a show that will only run one time!

      We've been frugal, but to cloth and arm our fighters, we've exhausted the majority of our budget, and need your help to put on the finishing touches.

      We have a cast made of professional stunt performers, martial arts teachers,  gymnastics instructors, experienced stage combatants and highly trained Shakespearean thespians.  For some, this is a first time endeavor, and a great learning experience. For others, this is the fourth, fifth or sixth live stunt show done by the DC Stunt Coalition, and they've earned the title of Champion.

       

      With this much experience and talent in one cast, we know we can make this an incredible show, we are just looking for whatever help you can give towards taking it over the edge!

      Unfortunately, as this is a fan convention, and not a traditional theatrical production, we aren't able to collect any profit from ticket sales. The only way for us to raise funds to pay our performers and crew is through your generosity.

        Split heavens with the sound of our name!

        We know not everyone can donate, and we only have a limited supply of perks to give out, but there's other ways you can help us become LEGENDS!

         

        We want it to be known that we're going to all of this effort to put on a unique and enthralling experience for fans of Spartacus, 300, Gladiator, and live stunt shows everywhere. DC Stunt Coalition has a presence on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, as well as our official website. Share our content, like and favorite our posts, and if you feel so inclined, tag, tweet and share it to the actors from the original television show like Liam McIntyre and Manu Bennett, so they know what kind of amazing tribute is being done towards their legacy.

         

        IndieGoGo also has plenty of Share tools for you to use! Click those!

        Spartacon will be premiering in the DC area on August 15th, 2015. If you can show up, you can join the crowds and cheer us on, stop by our merchandise booth, say hi, and tell us how much you enjoyed the show. If you want us to come back again, witness our epic gladiator fights, and answer that age-old question:

        "ARE YOU NOT ENTERTAINED!"

        Gratitude!

        Cast and Crew of the DC Stunt Coalition

story:
The members of Mondegreen Collective met as clowns in a Pig Iron Theater Company Workshop in 2014. While Princess Moo Shoo, Rampage, and Ruff Ruff McCockapoo don’t exactly play well with others, Jessica, Mal, and Paloma do, and so they set off to explore the dark, complex, seductive world of secrets and brutal honesty and their consequences in our day to day interactions.  CAPACITY FOR VERACITY draws from their experience as clowns, dancers, secret keepers, and theater makers and aims to obscurely clarify things for everyone on all possible levels at all possible times.

CAPACITY FOR VERACITY explores the veiling and unveiling of secrets, the transfer of power through confession, and the worlds created by the questionable decisions we make surrounding secrets and lies. CFV relies on the fullest potential of the space from floor to ceiling, nook to cranny, and shadow to spotlight to allow the audience to wonder, should we have left that stone unturned?  

CFV is all in the space.  We are dedicated to making work that speaks to and through the show’s specific location.  In order to create the most fun space for our audience and creators, we need to pay our incredibly talented design team and give them the means with which to install the artistic playground we envision for the piece. Reaching our goal means fully exploring the potential energy of the space that we’ve been working toward for the last six months.

We are currently funding this show out of pocket.  The $2500 we are aiming to raise will go toward:

- Compensating our artists, without whom we could not make this happen!

- Curating and building a world alongside our designers!

- Covering performance and rehearsal fees for the space that we so dearly love!

WHAT YOUR DONATION PROVIDES:

$10 provides 50 palm cards to get the word out about our show

$25 provides a day of rehearsal in our performance space

$60 contributes to the creation of our dream space

$125 provides for photographic documentation of our show

$300 covers the entirety of our venue’s performance fees

$500 contributes mightily to the compensation of our design team

IF WE EXCEED OUR GOAL:

The difference between our minimum and maximum fundraising goal is that the latter allows us to compensate our artists not just through what we can scrape out of our piggy banks but in an amount equal to what they have earned through incredibly hard work and creative input. 

Every donation helps. Sharing this page on social media will also help get us closer to our goal. We value your generosity and support!

With love and gratitude,

Mondegreen Collective

(Mal Cherifi, Jessica Creane & Paloma Irizarry)

For Tickets: http://fringearts.com/event/capacity-for-veracity/

story:
Dirk Danger is Back on Stage!

Hi, I'm Dave Coste and we're bringing back the theater and film program at Esperanza Lutheran Church. But the church and I need your help!  Here's what Esperanza musicals do:

  • Produce original works that experiences faith in a different way.
  • Involves people of all ages in all aspects of production.
  • Creates shows that are accessible and open to the community.

Alumni of previous Esperanza shows have moved on to film and theater in high school, college, community and in professional venues.

Help Us Bring Back a Great Theater Program!

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Contributions to $5,000 will go toward the production of Dirk Danger and the Lady in White.  Expenses include director's fees, professional stage lighting and sound, the production of a cast album, set building supplies, publicity and other miscellaneous expenses.
  • But we don't want to stop there!  Contributions above $5,000 will go to seed future Esperanza plays, musicals and film projects.

Dirk Danger and the Lady in White

This will be the third production of Dirk Danger, the first since 2009

  • All kids who audition get a part
  • The rehearsal schedule is compact, so there's no overbearing commitment
  • There is no fee for being in the production
  • Tickets are sold as "suggested donation", so those who can't afford a ticket can still see the production.

Setting the Stage

It takes a lot of hands and strong funding to create a professional looking stage for our actors and audience. Esperanza Lutheran Church is the perfect place to transform to a quality theater experience, but there are technical concerns - lights need to be rented and the stage needs to be wired for sound, and more.

Please help get the word out!

If we all pitch in, we can make this work!  Please share this site with everyone you know - people who have been part of the process in the past, people who are in it now as the new generation, and anyone interested in accessible community theater.

THANK YOU  and see you on opening night!

story:
In Toxic

My name is Tara Hershberger. I am a playwright, director, actor, musician, and high school teacher. I am passionate about theatre, the accessibility of arts, social justice, protecting the environment, and transitioning to sustainable lifestyles. 

This play began many years ago, based in the story of a family dealing with addiction and recovery. It had a workshop performance in April, 2015 with an amazing reception. The majority of the cast and crew have returned to work on this transformative play for a larger audience at Portland's Fertile Ground Festival, an 11-day arts festival that will be held January 21 through 31 in Portland, OR, which features the finest new work of local artists, performers and resident theatre companies. http://fertilegroundpdx.org/

In Toxic is important to those of us at World's Edge Players because of the power of it's message, the beauty of the language, and the creative energy collaboratively poured into it.

Your contributions will help us realize this production, fund our budget for logistics needs, and pay actors, and technicians for their skilled work.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $2,000. The vast majority of this money will go to actors, designers, stage managers, and the writer/director. $1,400 will be divided between 8 cast members, and 6 creative/crew members. These individuals will commit themselves to a month of rehearsal and design in service to their art. This money will guarantee a minimum stipend, in addition to a share of income from ticket sales. $200 will go to administrative costs, including registration fees and box office service. $400 will go to costs of purchasing/creating costumes, props, and set pieces. 

Perks include a signed show poster, special guest treatment at the show, and dinner with any member of the cast and crew. 

The Impact

At the heart of In Toxic is a story of love between sisters, and also of addiction, heartache, rejection, and redemption. It is set against the backdrop of a community and a wetlands being destroyed by transportation of coal and oil. 

An estimated 200 people experienced the workshop production. The play had a powerful impact on the audience, moving many to tears. It has a huge impact on the people who helped create the workshop, and who are invested in the creative journey of In Toxic as we seek a stronger, revised script and a larger audience. 

"I am so grateful to be a part of this creative and meaningful production."               Eva Andrews

"It was an honor to speak [these] words, and a privilege to use [this] story to change the breathing of an audience. This is a fine piece of art."
John Bruner

Other Ways You Can Help

Come and see the show! It is Jan. 22-24 at the Clinton St. Theater in Portland, OR. 

https://cstpdx.com/show/toxic 

Help us to get the word out and make some noise for In Toxic! And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
