story:
Origins

I initially came up with this project back in college where I was first introduced to circus. On the heels of the "Pippin" revival, "Moulin Rouge" immediately stood out as being the perfect vehicle for a blend of theater and circus. The larger than life performances, the intimate love story, not to mention the music. 
A little bit about myself - I'm a recent college graduate from Vassar with a degree in drama. Outside of classes, I spent the majority of my time with the campus circus club learning new skills in acrobatics and object manipulation, quickly gaining the confidence to choreograph pieces for shows.
This project has been a dream I have been working towards ever since it popped into my head nearly 4 years ago. It has continuously evolved over the years and it is time for it to see the light of day.

Bang for Your Buck

The main goal of this campaign is to make sure I can pay the performers, and creative team, who will make this show happen. In an ideal world I would have $1,300 for the crew and $1,200 for the performers. The balance will be used to purchase needed props, costumes, and the venue. The listed goal for this campaign would cover all of those costs, and the entire cost of the venue.

Rest assured that in the event the listed goal is not met, the show will go on, but I will not be able to pay my team as much as I would like. While this show could run on a reduced budget, the more you give the more I am able to reimburse the talented artists working with me. 

But what do you get in exchange? Obviously, I will be eternally grateful for anything you donate. If you choose, your name can be listed in the program, and you can even receive a handwritten note for your contribution. 

The biggest perk I have to offer, is the behind the scenes video. Throughout the rehearsal process, we will shoot videos of table readings, scene work, performers learning choreography sequences, conversations with performers and designers - every step of the process. This will ultimately be edited and put together in an exclusive video, which will be emailed to you after the show closes. 


Boom for the Bang

Besides literally making a personal dream of mine come true, this will also have a large impact on the circus and theater communities by continuing to encourage the blending of these two beautiful mediums. It started with the "Pippin" revival. Cirque du Soleil is bringing "Paramour" to Broadway in April. This show will make genre bending in circus even more accessible to the mainstream. 

For people who love this movie, the music, circus, live theater - this show will be a great way for them to experience all of these things at once.


Risks & Challenges

I recognize this is a huge endeavor. It is not just a play, or a circus show. It is both. Additionally, I could be seen as young, inexperienced, or taking on more than I can chew. 
This project is daunting, but I am doing everything I can to anticipate, and meet challenges. The show is significantly more streamlined than the film: shorter, and more concise so that I will not be rushing through the material during rehearsal. I am also currently working on a rehearsal plan, choreography and technical prep so that I am as prepared as possible. 
Additionally, while putting on my own show might be a first for me - I am not unfamiliar with running rehearsals or managing performance spaces. During my time in college, I choreographed dozens of numbers and helped manage circus rehearsals involving more than 50 people. I am also putting together a phenomenal team to help direct, stage manage and design in order to ensure all aspects of the show are given the attention they deserve.
I understand that not everyone can give, but if you choose not to give, I ask that you please share this amongst your friends via social media, IndieGogo and all the rest: get this campaign out there and we can make this show happen!

story:
Who We Are 

Cosmic Light is a brand new installment of tradition, a Rocky Horror Picture Show Shadow Cast. Based out of Austin, we know not only how to 'keep things weird', but how to keep things sexy. 

  • RHPS encourages acceptance, safety and freedom of expression 
  • This campaign contributes to the community of Austin, affordable fun, and keeping the spirit alive! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funding will provide for costuming, props, set pieces and further essentials to putting on a show
  • Funding this Project will encourage LGBT outreach in Austin Neighborhoods 

The Impact

RHPS Shadow Casts have historically provided a safe place for young adults in urban settings. 


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Subscribe to our facebook page: Cosmic Light 
2. Share us on Facebook
3. Tell your friends and family about us

story:
The  Project : Twelve actors, from around the world, passionate about Shakespeare, Shakespeare’s Globe Theatre fellowship attendees, stage a Shakespearean play in honour of the Bard which mixes cultures and languages. 

A unique experience, born from the encounter of actors from The International Actors’ Fellowship 2015 in Shakespeare’s Globe, in order to share their passion for the Bard, to explore his resonance through different cultures, artistic experiences all around the world, while showcasing out the special feature of their languages. 

An international cast : the cast gather 12 actors from 8 different countries (Australia, Brazil, Canada, France, Italy, Korea, Mexico, New Zealand, Pakistan ) to perform a play written in English by William Shakespeare, while building on global languages, diversity and musicality through the text. 

The drive of an international diffusion with a development residency in Mexico and  then involvement in Shakespeare’s Festivals all over the world.

A popular project which shows that Shakespeare is accessible to novices and connoisseurs alike.

This process will help us to raise money to start our first production : to pay for costumes, setting and lighting; to work with a great stage designer, a costume designer and choreographer. Moreover, it will allow us to have a residency period in Mexico where the show will be developed and performed for the first time.

William Shakespeare's The Comedy of Errors" is a riotous, farce-paced comedy about mistaken identity, the problems money can create, the problems money can fix, conflict resolution, international relations, and nuns with pasts. This is a broad, fast, crowd-pleasing comedy by a young playwright keen for a hit - that one big smash that will make his name and set him up.

It is thus imperative that this production mine its comic wells - both in the script and in the company of actors - and give our audience what is promised in the play's very title... COMEDY: fast-paced, truthful,detailed, intelligent, disciplined, raunchy, side-splitting, world-class large-cast comedy !

story:
WHO WE ARE
Off Broadway West Theatre Company is a small award-winning San Francisco-based non-profit 501(c)(3) company.

Established in 2006 by a group of theatre professionals determined to create lively and original art for an audience that seeks to be challenged as well as entertained. In our tenth year producing theater in San Francisco we are thrilled to be collaborating with playwright Patricia Milton on a world premiere. Her new play explores questions of loyalty, grief, forgiveness, and redemption when a family is thrust into a circumstance where their choices have ultimate consequences in a capital murder case. Playwright Milton brings the often abstract legal question of capital punishment into the direct personal experience of the involved parties.

WHY WE’RE DOING THIS

Theatre can be used to ask gripping, critical, and topical questions that affect all of us as human beings. Are there acts that are unforgivable? Can forgiveness, mercy, and justice co-exist? And how do we best bestow them? This play brings the immediacy of a family grappling with these moral and emotional issues onstage. As citizens, we will be asked to wrestle with questions of life and death in the voting booth this November. California's upcoming ballot has competing measures regarding the administration of the death penalty; one seeks to ban the execution of prisoners convicted of capital crimes, while the other aims to expedite the process. Our responsibility as citizens could not be more consequential. 

WHAT YOUR HELP MEANS TO US

The life of an independent theatrical company can be precarious. We perform in a 50 seat theater. Though our shows are very well received and attended, the costs of production necessarily exceed the income we can earn at the box office. Thus we must rely on the help of the community. Because we are a non-profit, all contributions to Off Broadway West are fully tax deductible to the extent allowed by law.

You will have the satisfaction of contributing to the creation of a new play, from the ground up, ensuring the artists receive compensation. Your participation is crucial to bring this new work into being.

Patricia Milton is an award-winning, internationally-produced playwright and a San Francisco native. Her plays uniquely blend the personal and the political. Theatre Bay Area editor Kim Cohan wrote of her work, “Patricia is a pro at blending painfully direct and on-point social and/or political commentary with ... relatable characters.” Her play juxtaposing domestic abuse and US foreign policy, “Enemies: Foreign and Domestic,” was awarded Theatre Bay Area’s 2015 Outstanding World Premiere Award, and her satire about modern colonialism, “Hearts of Palm” played to sold-out houses this summer at Central Works in Berkeley. She is resident playwright at Central Works, and her full-length and short plays have been produced locally at New Conservatory Theatre Center, 3Girls Theatre, San Francisco Exploratorium, PianoFight, and Wily West Productions, among others. You can check out Patricia's works on her website.

What We Need

We seek $10,000 to help fund this production. At OBW, all of the money ends up on the stage in one way or another. The artists and designers who work with us are all professionals; we cannot ask them to work for free. Our total production costs will amount to nearly $25,000.00. $7,000 will fund stipends for 11 people: actors; scenic, lighting, and costume designers; director fee, playwright’s royalty, a stage manager and a running crew. The theatre rental itself amounts to over $5,000.

  • Estimated Budget:

    • Production Crew - $7,400

    • Talent - $3,000

    • Space Rental- $6,000

    • Set, Costumes, Lighting- $2,600

    • Marketing - $7,000

    • Total Production Cost- $26,000

    • Total Production Income+ $16,000

    • Profit/Loss<$10,000>

We have some great gifts on offer at all levels to thank you for your donation. Check them out. And most of all come to the show.


The Impact

Our acclaimed past productions  include plays by outstanding playwrights Including Shakespeare and Ibsen, Harold Pinter, Arthur Miller and Athol Fugard, Yasmina Reza and Steven Dietz, and now Patricia Milton. Producing a brand new, topical play with an award-winning local playwright is our next artistic endeavor, and you can be a part of it!

PLAY SYNOPSIS

Is there anything that you could not forgive?

Working Title: "Without Mercy"

by Patricia Milton

2w. 1m.

    • Joanna, mother, teacher, 50's

    • Bethany, psychologist, 30's

    • Sam, their advocate attorney, flexible age

Single set.

Six years ago, Joanna’s daughter, Mercy, disappeared from her home. At last, a suspect, Richard Derek Cooper, has confessed and may stand trial for Mercy’s abduction and murder through circumstantial evidence, and his own admission, as her body was never recovered. Joanna is determined she and her other daughter, Bethany, will speak at the trial, to read victim’s statements about the emotional damage Cooper has caused the family. Joanna’s need for an open declaration of the harm committed, and to speak publicly of the impact of her daughter’s death, runs deep.

They reach an impasse when their family advocate arrives with a plea offer. As the three convene in Bethany’s home in Ukiah, California, Joanna is shocked to learn that Bethany is eager to accept a plea deal. Unlike her mother, Bethany wants to reject the possibility of the death penalty in favor of a lighter sentence for Cooper. Bethany is a psychologist whose work in the local jail has given her a first-hand look at the injustices of the system, and she is reluctant to condemn anyone … even the man who may have killed her sister. She also bears information about Mercy’s activities on the day of the murder that doesn’t line up with testimony given by Joanna herself.

As the realities of Mercy’s disappearance and its aftermath are examined, each woman defends her right to forgive or seek vengeance, and each claims justice is hers. The play looks at the concept of forgiveness in relationship to justice. When is forgiveness a cop-out? How is culpability determined when good intentions cause irreparable harm? What does the injustice of our justice system mean for victims and their families?

Other Ways You Can Help

We get it. There are lots of demands on your time and money; not everybody can afford to contribute. You can still help us by sharing this link with your circle via email, and on social media and letting other people know what we’re up to. Please tell all your friends, and use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Candy Shop Show Australia are a group of LOCAL BRISBANE ARTISTS committed to producing high-quality dance cabaret works which aim to widen the audience for dance-based cabaret productions in Queensland, as well as provide opportunities for local artists.

We love our city and we love our artists, and therefore we want to create paid employment opportunities for our very talented team! In Brisbane this can be tough, so we need your help to keep producing work!

Showing 11-21 May
The Retro Bar www.theretrobar.com.au
Tickets via www.candyshopshow.net
Presented as part of the Anywhere Festival 2016

Sugar, Sugar! is the sequel to The Jazz Age Dance Cabaret and is a fun, light-hearted music and dance journey through the 50s, 60s, 70s and 80s. Miss Peppermint Twist, Miss Skittle, Miss Starburst and Miss Everlasting Gobstopper are your luscious-leggy-lolly-hosts on a marvellous musical journey through the retro era! Featuring fabulous dance numbers, stunning vocals and spectacular costumes Sugar, Sugar! is a cheeky fix guaranteed to satisfy any sweet tooth!

Presenting even a small show is very expensive for a small independent company and costs such as performer fees, APRA fees, costuming, music, rehearsal room hire, marketing and general producing costs can be crippling. We don't want to be greedy and we understand limitations in disposable income in this day and age so we want all proceeds from this campaign to go STRAIGHT TO THE ARTISTS! We hope our ticket sales can cover the boring expenses associated with producing a work and this is where we need your help! 

We believe in artists being PROPERLY PAID for their talent, time and extraordinary energy - please help us achieve our funding goals!

Our Team

Jenny Usher - Director/Choreographer/Performer/Producer
Anna Welch, Maureen Bowra & Natalie Renouf - Performers (additional choreography)
Lucy Kelland - Stage Manager

What We Need 

We aim to raise $2000 to provide our hard-working and dedicated team with a contribution fee for rehearsals and performances.

We want to keep the industry in Queensland alive for dance and cabaret artists!

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can support us is to purchase a ticket to our show here , but if you can't make it or would like to provide additional support then we are truly and deeply very, very grateful! This campaign is perfect for friends and family who live interstate to offer their support.

We also understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please ask your networks and friends to get the word out there and make some noise about our campaign
  • You can easily share this campaign on social media by using the Indiegogo Share Tools

We are so grateful for any and all donations big and small, and we thank you in advance for supporting not only Candy Shop Show but the wider arts, dance, cabaret and theatre industry!

story:
Help us take new, one woman play 'Villain' by Martin Murphy to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival

 

Villain is a new one woman play by Martin Murphy.  This summer we are delighted to have confirmed a run at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival with Underbelly. We hope that the Edinburgh run will allow us to showcase the play in order to organise a UK tour and London run, to give this inspiring play a life beyond the fringe. We are looking for backers to help us make this happen.

Tired of her highly paid sales job, Rachel makes a move into social work only to find herself involved in a controversial case bringing her into the media's unforgiving gaze. Villain tells the story of a woman who wants to make a difference.

Dark, topical and hilarious in places.

On the writer's previous play Manor

“Powerful” WhatsOnStage 

“Brutally beautiful” Remote Goat 

“Captivating dialogue” Spoonfed 

“Martin Murphy’s writing is brutal, poetic and bloody funny. A play which deserves to be seen in the flesh” David Scinto writer, Sexy Beast

Who We Are

Bruised Sky Productions

Our aim at Bruised Sky is to push the boundaries of theatre and film.

We make raw, passionate, truthful work.

We want new productions with no limits. No excuses.

Martin Murphy – Playwright and Executive Director

Martin's previous writing credits for theatre include Manor (Soho Theatre then Tristan Bates, Covent Garden) and Barren (Old Vic) as well as numerous works at venues including Liverpool Everyman Theatre. For screen Martin's work includes the short film Poisoned and his first feature is currently in development for Rebel Without Crew Films.

Jules Haworth – Associate Producer and Dramaturg

Jules is Education Producer at Soho Theatre and runs Writers' Lab and Comedy Lab for emerging artists. She has read for a number of playwriting competitions including the Verity Bargate Award, Soho Young Playwrights and Soho Young Writers' Award.

As a freelance dramaturg Jules has worked on shows including Brute by Izzy Tennyson (Ideas Tap Underbelly Award 2015, Underbelly), Muscovado by Matilda Ibini (Alfred Fagon Award 2015, Theatre 503), Your Image by Gemma Copping (Soho Young Writers' Award 2013) Villain by Martin Murphy, Greywing House by Mary Beth Morossa (Vault Festival) and The Dogs of War by Tim Foley (Old Red Lion).

Jules has also appeared as a panellist for Sphinx Theatre's Women Centre Stage and as a judge for Directors Cut (Pleasance Theatre). Her play Pigeon Steps was longlisted for the Adrian Pagan Award 2014.

Hannah Cox – Associate Producer

Hannah is Education Manager at Southbank Centre and has been working in Arts Education for 12 years. She has extensive experience programming and producing for Southbank Centre, Soho Theatre, and numerous smaller organisations, as well as running her own company Crafternoon Cabaret Club. Hannah is a passionate advocate for political theatre and new writing.

Kevin Millband – Technical Manager

Kevin trained in Sound Design and has worked as a technician in a range of venues including Soho Theatre and the Edinburgh Fringe.

James Kermack – Artistic Director

James is the founder member of the company. His first feature as a writer/director Hi-Lo Joe, was completed in 2015 and shot on a low budget. It will be showing at the New York and Singapore International Film Festivals in 2016. It has also been selected as part of the BFI Breakthrough strand playing at the BFI in June. His second feature is currently in development and preparing for a 2017 shoot.

The Play

This play has been written to place a spotlight on the growing pressures on social workers and social care agencies, the growth of child poverty, and how the media approaches 'public interest' stories.  The play has been developed through research into past true-life cases and interviews with social workers.

Over the last ten years the growth of social media has allowed us to connect across the world but has also led us to delve further and further into the personal lives of anyone who happens to fall under the spotlight.  Can you try and do good without bringing risk to yourself?  What really qualifies as public interest? 

Why we need you

Taking a show to Edinburgh is an expensive undertaking, but a huge opportunity. We will be fundraising through previews, as well as personally investing in the show.  However we are also hoping to secure investments, of every size, to help us cover these costs:

- Paying our actress and marketing team.

- Cover travel and accommodation for the company (actress, playwright, assistant and technician)

- Pay for marketing materials such as flyers, posters and brochure listings .

We are looking to raise £6,000 to support this show and give this important story a future life.  Our fundraising objectives mean that every penny of money made through ticket sales up at the fringe can then be reinvested into a London run and UK tour of this play.

How to donate

You can donate via this Indiegogo campaign where we have a range of fantastic rewards waiting for you for donations ranging from £10 to £500.

Become a Bruised Sky Angel

Every sky needs its angels and we’re looking for generous patrons to donate amounts of £1,000+.  Our angels will receive a credit as an Executive Producer in our marketing and online, signed copies of the playscript and poster and our everlasting gratitude, as well as being invited to attend a special performance with friends after the Fringe.

Other ways you can help

You can also help us by sharing this campaign with your friends and colleagues and spreading the word on social media about the Edinburgh run.

#VillainPlay

@BruisedSky

www.bruisedskyproductions.com
story_txt:
Help us take new, one woman play 'Villain' by Martin Murphy to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival
 Villain is a new one woman play by Martin Murphy.  This summer we are delighted to have confirmed a run at the Edinburgh Fringe Festival with Underbelly. We hope that the Edinburgh run will allow us to showcase the play in order to organise a UK tour and London run, to give this inspiring play a life beyond the fringe. We are looking for backers to help us make this happen.Tired of her highly paid sales job, Rachel makes a move into social work only to find herself involved in a controversial case bringing her into the media's unforgiving gaze. Villain tells the story of a woman who wants to make a difference.Dark, topical and hilarious in places.On the writer's previous play Manor“Powerful” WhatsOnStage “Brutally beautiful” Remote Goat “Captivating dialogue” Spoonfed “Martin Murphy’s writing is brutal, poetic and bloody funny. A play which deserves to be seen in the flesh” David Scinto writer, Sexy BeastWho We Are
Bruised Sky ProductionsOur aim at Bruised Sky is to push the boundaries of theatre and film.We make raw, passionate, truthful work.We want new productions with no limits. No excuses.Martin Murphy – Playwright and Executive DirectorMartin's previous writing credits for theatre include Manor (Soho Theatre then Tristan Bates, Covent Garden) and Barren (Old Vic) as well as numerous works at venues including Liverpool Everyman Theatre. For screen Martin's work includes the short film Poisoned and his first feature is currently in development for Rebel Without Crew Films.Jules Haworth – Associate Producer and DramaturgJules is Education Producer at Soho Theatre and runs Writers' Lab and Comedy Lab for emerging artists. - Paying our actress and marketing team.

story:
Summary

Arco Iris is about the immigrant experience from a woman's perspective. We aim to unite communities and inspire compassion & respect. We hope to hear each others' stories and honor our humanity. 

We need to raise 5,000 dollars or more to produce Arco Iris, and we can't do it without your support. Our show, premiering in November in Los Angeles, will feature blacklight performances of aerial, dance, and flow arts. Our shows are family friendly and affordable for all.  Your gifts help us purchase props & costumes, rent a venue & rehearsal space, hire a photographer, and more, while keeping ticket prices low and accessible for all. 

"I have no country to fight for: my country is the earth, and I am a citizen of the world."  - Eugene Debs

ABOUT US
We are Critical Mass Dance Company, a 501c3 nonprofit organization that aims to empower women to be active leaders and community members using dance and movement. CMDC was founded 5 years ago by a diverse group of activist women in Los Angeles. Thanks to your support, we have self-produced Love Movement, Collective Metamorphosis, and Amaterra.  Recently, we have performed Amaterra for various communities around Los Angeles. Amaterra is a story of transformation inspired by the journey of the monarch butterflies.  Our next AmaTerra show is June 25, 2016 at the Ivy Substation in Culver City, CA.

Our Goals

Our campaign goal of 5,000 dollars will fund our basic needs to develop and premiere our new work, Arco Iris in November 2016.  Our goal of 10,000 dollars will help us tour Arco Iris through Southern California in 2017. Our ultimate goal of 50,000 dollars will fund our entire 2016-2017 season and allow our volunteer-run organization to hire staff. These resources will enable us to support more working artists, inspire more hearts, and empower more women. 


Donating to CMDC means supporting local artists, community activism, and women and girls everywhere. Stay involved -- check out our weekly healing dance classes in Koreatown, or join our community on Facebook and Instagram. 

facebook.com/criticalmassdancecompany

instagram.com/criticalmassdancecompany

story:
We Create Legacies

There is a belief that once your name is spoken for the last time, after your life has ended, that is when you’ve truly passed from this Earth. Our passion is to create art from life stories and from that, produce original, thought-provoking, and life-affirming theatrical productions so that their legacy will live on. Theater provides a powerful vehicle to express the universality of life’s experiences and what it is to be human. This is the mission of Passing Words.

We are seeking funds to support our first production that will include marketing, the rental of a theater, rehearsal space, performers, sets, costumes, lighting and set design.

When you contribute to our project you can receive the following perks:

  • Passing Words t-shirt
  • Passing Words tote bag
  • Journal and pen set with custom logo
  • VIP Package that includes opening night refreshments and premiere seating.

We are so grateful for any contribution you can make in helping us actualize our mission by bringing the JMJ Project to life. This project is supported in part by a Theater Bay Area CA$H Grant.

Please go to www.passingwords.com to learn more about us.

story:
Who are we? What are we doing?

  • Composed of recent U of MN college grads, Grand Island Theatre was borne out of a trip during which the founding members spent several surreal days stranded in Grand Island, Nebraska. You can find our faces and names here: www.grandislandtheatre.com
  • Hamlet, but Hamlet's a Chicken is just what the title describes and everything that arises from this small casting change. 
  • This play has been years in the making, but we needed to make sure the chicken(s) we cast would be cared for and kept safe. We now have that assurance thanks to our association with the amazing organization: PAWS.  Chicken safety is our priority.

What We Need & Why

  • Our goal of $1200 will offset cost of production, marketing, compensating the actors and crew, and will include a substantial donation to PAWS for their assistance on this project.
  • There will be various levels of donation options ranging from $10 to $300. Perks include a personalized thank you, a mention in our program, and in the upper levels: customized and beautifully painted Ukrainian eggs by company member and resident Ukrainian Artist, Danylo Loutchko.
  • Regardless of how much we raise, $200 will be given to PAWS as they have graciously donated the talents of their therapy chickens: Tilly, Layla, and Henley. If you wish to also donate directly to PAWS, please click here.

Your Impact

  • While we are fortunate enough to live in a city with ample opportunities for theatre, the cost of self-producing can often be prohibitive. Hundreds of hours of work often goes uncompensated, and your contribution can be a remedy.
  • We rely on countless friends and artists who give their time and talent. We try our best to compensate them fairly, but that's not always possible.
  •  We already have one Fringe show, What You Will, under our belt, which was met with critical acclaim. However, despite selling well, we only received a shared profit of $6.
  • Pet Away Worry and Stress (PAWS) provides a space for students to interact with animals as a means of improving mental health and reducing stress. Your contribution will directly support this wonderful organization. 

Risks & Challenges

  • This is primarily a devised piece of theatre and while we have a strong production and artistic plan of action, challenges are always present. But, no such challenge will stop us from putting on this play. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about Hamlet, But Hamlet's a Chicken. It's really easy.
  • Follow us on Facebook. 
  • Come see us! You can find tickets and show dates here!

Thank you for your support!

story:
ENGLISH (first) / FRENCH (second) / PORTUGUESE (third) / ITALIAN (forth)

 

(in English)

The Project 

Run by the Paris based company, Fool's Cap Theatre, directed by the Brazilian choreographer and performer, Vinicius Carvalho, the project "Attachés" (Attached) started from a research on the expression of the body and on very basic elements of the physical movement. The aim is to create an 80 minutes performance, mixing dance, theatre, mime and going beyond our cultural borders.

The team is composed by five performers, one musician, a lighting designer, a costume maker, a video and photo artist and an administrative team, all coming from different artistic and cultural backgrounds, including France, Brazil, UK, Colombia and Italy. 
The piece will be performed in December 2019 in Paris and tour internationally in 2020/2021.
For all that, we need your support!


The show

"Attachés" (Attached) - piece (in progress)
Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&t=7s

"Attachés" (Attached) is the third project by the company, dealing with our necessity of being attached. Attached to the other, attached to our daily routines and habits, to our vices. Attached to objects, ideologies, memory, religion; attached to our families, countries and relationships. The fear of being alone or the uncomfortableness of having "nothing to do" generates in us the impulse to look around us and to relate to the world. This mechanism is not bad or good, it's part of our human condition. We often create our gods: god-marriage, god-money, god-work, god-alcohol, god-beliefs, god-phones...
Although it is part of our human nature to "need" things and people, we know deeply down that, at some point, we can lose them all. Then we will have to find a way of living without them. In this moment, we start questioning the nature of our happiness and what we really need. Then, we may be able to work on the other side of the coin: the detachment of our needs.

Provisional calendar:
* 25th feb to 2nd Mar 2019: residence at Centre National de la Danse in Paris (France)                    * 4th to 16th Mar 2019: residence at La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne (France)
* August 26th to September 14th, 2019: residence at S'ALA (Igor&Moreno company)  (Italy)        * 2nd to 12th December 2019: rehearsal at La Ménagerie de Verre (Paris) 
* December 12th and 13th, 2019: Preview at Espace Beaujon in Paris

 

Choreography and dramaturgy 
Vinicius Carvalho, in collaboration with Barbara Mangano

Performers devisers
Barbara Mangano, Danilo Sekic, Liane Masson, Marianna Cifarelli and Vinicius Carvalho
In the devising process: Chiara Capitani and Elena Michelin

Music composition
Alex Paton

Photo, video
Carmen Rozzonelli

Production
Fool’s Cap Theatre and Culturelles Production

 

The company

Fool's Cap Theatre

website: www.foolscaptheatre.com

Fool's Cap Theatre is an international performing arts company founded in 2015. Recently relocated from London to Paris, the company has presented its works throughout Europe, Brazil, India and Korea. We always engage a multicultural ensemble of artists because that's the way we like working, and how we believe we could create something richer. We combine creation and pedagogy based on devising, group work and movement.

A few reviews on the work are:

“A ballet of colourful life, playful and full of hope!“   (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)

"...Spellbinding" (Reviews Gate)

"...a visual treat" (The Times of India)

“Mesmerising, to say the least” (Telangana Today)

"...standing ovation and undying applauses from the audience" (The Times of India)

Our partners: We have already gathered important partners such as the European Cultural Foundation; the Danish Arts Foundation; the Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne, La Ménagerie de Verre; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; Espace Beaujon and Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).


Other projects by the company: 
- "Timing" (2017): https://youtu.be/CPWjOQhP0do
- "The Unparalleled Adventure of One Hans Pfaall" (2016): https://youtu.be/dz9lD5qxBeo
- "Streets of Frequency" (2014): https://youtu.be/8p6KvK3AZ5M
- "Number of the Chair" (2005): https://youtu.be/ErVU4PDHRD4

Pedagogy projects:
- Workshop "The World of Metaphors": https://youtu.be/geDXGU49y4Y
- Workshop "Movement as the Starting Point": https://youtu.be/_89StTHIZGo

- Photos: https://www.flickr.com/photos/132070765@N04/

 

The support we need: 

We are due to perform the finished piece in this December 2019 at the Espace Beaujon, in Paris, France. We are 6 people on the stage (5 performers and one musician). We are looking for financial support to fully develop the piece and give it the quality it deserves. So we can give it back to the community. 

All funding collected in this platform will serve to pay the artists involved. We are searching for other funding opportunities and we are waiting for a couple of answers, from supporters such as the Ville de Paris and Spedidam.

As an exchange you will be added to the priority list of the company, having your name on the programme of the show, on the website and social media pages of the company, getting free tickets to see shows and participate in workshops, as well as other special treats such as a meal with the team or following the process live.

 

The Impact

Your support will contribute to the making of the show and to paying a fare fee to the artists. For us, it will be a present and an encouragement to keep doing what we do. For the community, it will be a way of sharing, meeting and celebrating live relationships.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us also getting the word out (loud), making some noise about our project. Sharing with your friends, family members and people you may think could be interested.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH !

 

 

(en français)

Le Projet

Porté par la compagnie parisienne, Fool's Cap Theatre, dirigé par le chorégraphe et interprète brésilien, Vinicius Carvalho, le projet "Attachés" est né d'une recherche sur l'expression du corps et sur des éléments fondamentaux du mouvement. L’objectif est de créer un spectacle de 80 minutes alliant danse, théâtre, mime et dépassant nos frontières culturelles.

L’équipe est composée de cinq interprètes, un musicien, un régisseur lumière, un costumier, un artiste vidéaste et une équipe administrative, tous issus de milieux artistiques et culturels différents (France, Brésil, Royaume-Uni, Colombie et Italie).
La pièce sera jouée en décembre 2019 à Paris et fera une tournée internationale en 2020/2021.
Malgré tout, nous avons besoin de votre soutien!

 

Le spectacle

"Attachés" - pièce (en cours de création)
Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&t=7s

Sur scène, cinq corps se rencontrent pour explorer individuellement, en couple, en trio, et en groupe, le thème de l’attachement. L’attachement à l’autre, à une habitude, à un objet, à une mémoire, à une religion, à un amour. La peur d'être seul ou l'inconfort de ne "rien faire", génère en nous l'impulsion de regarder autour de nous et de nouer des relations avec le monde. Ce mécanisme n'est ni mauvais ni bon, cela fait partie de notre condition humaine. Nous créons souvent nos dieux: dieu-mariage, dieu-argent, dieu-travail, dieu-alcool, dieu-croyances, dieu-portable ...
Bien que cela fasse partie de notre nature humaine de "besoin" des choses et des personnes, nous savons profondément que, à un moment donné, nous pouvons toutes les perdre. Ensuite, nous devrons trouver un moyen de vivre sans eux. En ce moment, nous commençons à nous interroger sur la nature de notre bonheur et sur ce dont nous avons vraiment besoin. Ensuite, nous pourrons peut-être travailler de l’autre côté de la médaille: le détachement de nos besoins.

Calendrier provisionnel : 
* 25 fév au 2 mar 2019 : résidence au Centre National de la Danse à Paris (France)
* 4 au 16 mar 2019 : résidence à La Briqueterie CDCN Val du Marne (France)
* 26 aout au 14 sep 2019 : résidence au espace S'ALA (Cie. Igor&Moreno) (Italy)
* 2 au 12 décembre 2019 : répétition à la Ménagerie de Verre, à Paris
* 12 et 13 décembre 2019 : Avant-première au Espace Beaujon à Paris
 

Chorégraphie et dramaturgie
Vinicius Carvalho, en collaboration avec Barbara Mangano

Artistes interprètes
Barbara Mangano, Danilo Sekic, Liane Masson, Marianna Cifarelli et Vinicius Carvalho
Dans le processus de création: Chiara Capitani et Elena Michelin

Composition musicale
Alex Paton

Photo, vidéo
Carmen Rozzonelli

Production
Fool’s Cap Theatre et Culturelles Production

 

La compagnie

Fool's Cap Theatre est une compagnie internationale de spectacle vivant fondée en 2014. Récemment déménagée de Londres à Paris, la compagnie a présenté ses œuvres dans toute l'Europe, au Brésil, en Inde et en Corée du Sud. Nous travaillons toujours avec un ensemble multiculturel d'artistes parce que c'est la manière dont nous aimons travailler et ce grâce à quoi nous croyons pouvoir créer quelque chose de plus riche. Nous combinons création et pédagogie basées sur un travail de groupe et à travers la recherche sur le mouvement.

Quelques critiques sur le travail sont:

« Un ballet de vie colorée, ludique et plein d'espoir! » (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)

«... Spellbinding » (Reviews Gate)

«... un régal visuel » (The Times of India)

« Hypnotisant, c'est le moins qu'on puisse dire » (Telangana Today)

«... ovation debout et applaudissements éternels du public » (The Times of India)

 

Nos partenaires: Nous avons déjà rassemblé d’importants partenaires tels que l'European Cultural Foundation; la fondation Danish Arts Foundation; le Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne ; La Ménagerie de Verre ; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); l'Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; l'Espace Beaujon et le Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).

 

Le soutien dont nous avons besoin:

Nous allons jouer la pièce finie en décembre 2019 à l'Espace Beaujon, à Paris, en France. Nous sommes 6 personnes sur le plateau (5 interprètes et un musicien). Nous recherchons un soutien financier pour développer pleinement la pièce et lui donner la qualité qu’elle mérite. Pour que nous puissions la restituer à la communauté.

Tous les fonds collectés sur cette plateforme serviront à payer les artistes engagés. Nous recherchons aussi d'autres sources de financement et attendons des réponses de la part de partenaires tels que la Ville de Paris et le Spedidam.

En contrepartie, votre nom figurera au programme du spectacle, sur le site internet et sur les pages de réseaux sociaux de la compagnie, vous recevrez des billets gratuits pour assister à des spectacles et participer à des ateliers. Et d’autres cadeaux, comme un repas avec l’équipe.

 

L'impact

Votre soutien contribuera à la réalisation du spectacle et au paiement des artistes. Pour nous, ce sera un cadeau et un encouragement pour continuer d'avancer dans notre projet. Pour la communauté, ce sera un moyen de partager et de se rencontrer en vrai.
 

D'autre façons dont vous pouvez nous aider

Aidez-nous également à faire passer (fort) le mot et à faire du bruit au sujet de notre projet. Partagez avec vos amis, les membres de votre famille et des personnes susceptibles de s'intéresser au projet.

 

MERCI !

 

 

(em português)

O Projeto

Produzido pela companhia de dança-teatro, Fool's Cap Theatre, sediada em Paris e dirigida pelo coreógrafo e performer brasileiro, Vinicius Carvalho, o "Attachés" (Apegados) partiu de uma pesquisa sobre a expressão do corpo e sobre elementos de base do movimento. O objetivo é criar um espetáculo de 80 minutos, combinando dança, teatro, mímica e ultrapassando nossas fronteiras culturais.

A equipe é composta por cinco atores-bailarinos, um músico, um designer de luz, um figurinista, um videoartista e uma equipe administrativa. Todos são provenientes de diferentes origens artísticas e culturais, incluindo França, Brasil, Reino Unido, Colômbia e Itália.
A peça será apresentada em dezembro de 2019 em Paris e fará turnê internacional em 2020/2021.
Por tudo isso, precisamos do seu apoio!

 

O espetáculo - 

Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&t=7s

"Attachés" (Apegados) 

"Attachés" (Apegados) é o terceiro projeto da companhia e trata da necessidade humana de apego. Apego ao outro, apego às nossas rotinas e hábitos, aos nossos vícios. Apego a objetos, ideologias, memória, religião; apego às nossas famílias, países e relacionamentos. O medo de ficar sozinho ou o desconforto de não ter "nada para fazer" gera em nós o impulso de olhar ao nosso redor e nos relacionar com o mundo. Esse mecanismo não é ruim ou bom, simplesmente faz parte da nossa condição humana. Frequentemente criamos nossos deuses: deus-casamento, deus-dinheiro, deus-trabalho, deus-álcool, deus-crenças, deus-celular...
Embora seja parte de nossa natureza humana "necessitar" de coisas e pessoas, no fundo sabemos que, em algum momento, podemos perder tudo. Então teremos que encontrar um meio de viver sem nossos apegos. Neste momento, começamos a questionar a natureza da nossa felicidade e do que realmente precisamos. Então, podemos trabalhar do outro lado da moeda: o desapego de nossas necessidades.

Calendário provisório:
* 25 de fev a 2 de março de 2019: residência no Centre National de la Danse à Paris (França)
* 4 de 16 de março de 2019: residência na La Briqueterie CDCN Val du Marne (França)
* 26 out out 14 set 2019: residência no espaço S'ALA (Cia. Igor & Moreno) (Itália)
* 2 de 12 de dezembro de 2019: ensaios na Ménagerie de Verre, à Paris
* 12 e 13 de dezembro de 2019: Pré-estréia no Espace Beaujon à Paris

 

Coreografia e dramaturgia 
Vinicius Carvalho, em colaboração com Barbara Mangano

Performers criadores
Barbara Mangano, Danilo Sekic, Liane Masson, Marianna Cifarelli e Vinicius Carvalho
Parte do processo criativo: Chiara Capitani e Elena Michelin

Criação música
Alex Paton

Photo, vídeo
Carmen Rozzonelli

Produção
Fool’s Cap Theatre e Culturelles Production

 

A Companhia

Fool's Cap Theatre

website: www.foolscaptheatre.com

Fool's Cap Theatre é uma companhia internacional de artes performáticas fundada em 2015. Recentemente re-locada de Londres para Paris, a companhia apresentou seus trabalhos pela Europa, Brasil, Índia e Coréia. Normalmente, trabalhamos com um grupo multicultural de artistas, pois é assim como gostamos de trabalhar e como acreditamos poder criar algo mais abrangente e rico. Combinamos criação e pedagogia com base no trabalho de grupo e na pesquisa do movimento.

Algumas críticas sobre o trabalho são:

“Um balé de vida colorida, divertido e cheio de esperança!” (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)

"... Encantador" (Reviews Gate)

"... um deleite visual" (The Times of India)

“Fascinante, para dizer o mínimo” (Telangana Today)

"... ovação de pé e aplausos intermináveis do público" (The Times of India)

Nossos parceiros: Já juntamos importantes parceiros, como European Cultural Foundation; the Danish Arts Foundation; the Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne, La Ménagerie de Verre; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; Espace Beaujon e Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).

 

Outros projetos da companhia: 
- "Timing" (2017): https://youtu.be/CPWjOQhP0do
- "The Unparalleled Adventure of One Hans Pfaall" (2016): https://youtu.be/dz9lD5qxBeo
- "Streets of Frequency" (2014): https://youtu.be/8p6KvK3AZ5M
- "Number of the Chair" (2005): https://youtu.be/ErVU4PDHRD4

Pedagogy projects:
- Workshop "The World of Metaphors": https://youtu.be/geDXGU49y4Y
- Workshop "Movement as the Starting Point": https://youtu.be/_89StTHIZGo

- Photos: https://www.flickr.com/photos/132070765@N04/


O suporte de que precisamos:

Apresentaremos a peça finalizada em dezembro de 2019 no Espace Beaujon, em Paris, França. Somos 6 pessoas no palco (5 atores-bailarinos e um músico). Estamos à procura de apoio financeiro para desenvolver plenamente a peça e dar-lhe a qualidade que merece. E assim devolvê-la à comunidade.

Todo o financiamento coletado nesta plataforma servirá para pagar os artistas envolvidos. Estamos à procura de outras oportunidades de financiamento e estamos à espera de algumas respostas de apoiadores, como a Ville de Paris e a Spedidam. 

Como troca, você será adicionado(a) à lista de prioritária da companhia, tendo seu nome no programa da peça, no site e nas páginas de mídia social da companhia, recebendo ingressos gratuitos para ver espetáculos e participar de workshops, bem como outros tratamentos especiais, como uma refeição com a equipe e seguir o processo criativo ao vivo.

 

O impacto

Seu apoio contribuirá para a realização do espetáculo e para o pagamento de um cachê digno aos artistas. Para nós, será um presente e um incentivo para continuarmos fazendo o que fazemos. Para a comunidade, será uma maneira de compartilhar, se conhecer e celebrar o encontro ao vivo.

 

Outras maneiras de ajudar

Ajude-nos a espalhar a notícia, fazendo um "auê" sobre o nosso projeto. Compartilhando com seus amigos, familiares e pessoas que você acha que poderiam estar interessadas.

 

MUITO OBRIGADO !

 

 

(en italiano)

La compagnia

 

Fool's Cap Theatre,  siamo una compagnia internazionale fondata nel 2014 a Londra. Trasferiti a Parigi di recente, giriamo con i nostri spettacoli in Europe, Brasile, India e Corea. Amiamo lavorare con un equipe di artisti multiculturali perché crediamo nella ricchezza portata dalla diversità. Portiamo avanti un lavoro di creazione e pedagogia basato su una ricerca sul movimento. 


Alcune critiche sul lavoro: 

« Un ballet de vie colorée, ludique et plein d'espoir! » (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)

«... Spellbinding » (Reviews Gate)

«... un régal visuel » (The Times of India)

« Hypnotisant, c'est le moins qu'on puisse dire » (Telangana Today)

«... ovation debout et applaudissements éternels du public » (The Times of India)


 

Lo spettacolo

"Attachés" é il terzo progetto della compagnia, in creazione dal 2017.

(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&amp...)

Sulla scena cinque corpi s'incontrano per esplorare individualmente, in coppia, in trio e in gruppo il tema dell'attaccamento. L'attaccamento all'altro, a un'abitudine, ad un oggetto, alla memoria, alla religione , all'amore. Partendo da una ricerca coreografica sul movimento, Attachés si presenta come uno studio sul linguaggio, cercando un cammino possibile tra la danza e il teatro gestuale.

Le nostre collaborazioni: Abbiamo già il sostegno di European Cultural Foundation; la fondazione Danish Arts Foundation; le Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne ; La Ménagerie de Verre ; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); l'Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; l'Espace Beaujon et le Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).

 

Il sostegno di cui abbiamo bisogno

Presenteremo lo spettacolo in dicembre à l'Espace Beaujon, à Pargi, in Francia. Siamo 6 persone sulla scena, cinque performers e un musicista. Cerchiamo un aiuto economico per sviluppare pienamente lo spettacolo e dargli la qualità che merita, per poterlo poi offrire al pubblico .

I soldi raccolti attraverso questa piattaforfa servirano a pagare gli artisi. Stiamo cercando altre fonti di finanziamento e aspettiamo delle risposte dal Comune di Parigi e dalla Spedidam.

In cambio del vostro aiuto : Il vostro nome figurerà nel programma di spettacolo, sul sito internet e sulle pagine dei socialnetwork della compagnia, riceverete dei biglietti gratuiti per assistere a degli spettacoli o partecipare a degli laboratori della compagnia e ci saranno altri regali possibili come per esempio un pranzo o una cena con la compagnia.

 

L'impatto del vostro aiuto

Il vostro sostegno contribuirà alla realizzazione dello spettacolo e al pagamento degli artisti. Per noi sarà un regalo e un incoraggiamento per continuare ad avanzare nel nostro progetto. Per tutti voi sarà una maniera di condividere il nostro lavoro e incontrarci di persona.

 

Altre maniere tramite le quali potete aiutarci

Aiutateci a diffondere questo messaggio e parlate del nostro progetto intorno a voi. Condividetelo con amici, famiglia e con le persone che pensate possano essere interessate a sostenerlo.

 

Grazie !
story_txt:
ENGLISH (first) / FRENCH (second) / PORTUGUESE (third) / ITALIAN (forth)
 
(in English)
The Project 
Run by the Paris based company, Fool's Cap Theatre, directed by the Brazilian choreographer and performer, Vinicius Carvalho, the project "Attachés" (Attached) started from a research on the expression of the body and on very basic elements of the physical movement. The aim is to create an 80 minutes performance, mixing dance, theatre, mime and going beyond our cultural borders.
The team is composed by five performers, one musician, a lighting designer, a costume maker, a video and photo artist and an administrative team, all coming from different artistic and cultural backgrounds, including France, Brazil, UK, Colombia and Italy. The piece will be performed in December 2019 in Paris and tour internationally in 2020/2021.For all that, we need your support!

The show

"Attachés" (Attached) - piece (in progress)Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&t=7s
"Attachés" (Attached) is the third project by the company, dealing with our necessity of being attached. Attached to the other, attached to our daily routines and habits, to our vices. Attached to objects, ideologies, memory, religion; attached to our families, countries and relationships. The fear of being alone or the uncomfortableness of having "nothing to do" generates in us the impulse to look around us and to relate to the world. This mechanism is not bad or good, it's part of our human condition. We often create our gods: god-marriage, god-money, god-work, god-alcohol, god-beliefs, god-phones...Although it is part of our human nature to "need" things and people, we know deeply down that, at some point, we can lose them all. Then we will have to find a way of living without them. In this moment, we start questioning the nature of our happiness and what we really need. Then, we may be able to work on the other side of the coin: the detachment of our needs.
Provisional calendar:* 25th feb to 2nd Mar 2019: residence at Centre National de la Danse in Paris (France)                    * 4th to 16th Mar 2019: residence at La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne (France)* August 26th to September 14th, 2019: residence at S'ALA (Igor&Moreno company)  (Italy)        * 2nd to 12th December 2019: rehearsal at La Ménagerie de Verre (Paris) * December 12th and 13th, 2019: Preview at Espace Beaujon in Paris
 
Choreography and dramaturgy Vinicius Carvalho, in collaboration with Barbara Mangano
Performers devisersBarbara Mangano, Danilo Sekic, Liane Masson, Marianna Cifarelli and Vinicius CarvalhoIn the devising process: Chiara Capitani and Elena Michelin
Music compositionAlex Paton

ProductionFool’s Cap Theatre and Culturelles Production
 
The company
Fool's Cap Theatre
website: www.foolscaptheatre.com
Fool's Cap Theatre is an international performing arts company founded in 2015. Recently relocated from London to Paris, the company has presented its works throughout Europe, Brazil, India and Korea. We always engage a multicultural ensemble of artists because that's the way we like working, and how we believe we could create something richer. We combine creation and pedagogy based on devising, group work and movement.
A few reviews on the work are:
“A ballet of colourful life, playful and full of hope!“   (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)
"...Spellbinding" (Reviews Gate)
"...a visual treat" (The Times of India)
“Mesmerising, to say the least” (Telangana Today)
"...standing ovation and undying applauses from the audience" (The Times of India)
Our partners: We have already gathered important partners such as the European Cultural Foundation; the Danish Arts Foundation; the Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne, La Ménagerie de Verre; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; Espace Beaujon and Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).
Other projects by the company: - "Timing" (2017): https://youtu.be/CPWjOQhP0do- "The Unparalleled Adventure of One Hans Pfaall" (2016): https://youtu.be/dz9lD5qxBeo- "Streets of Frequency" (2014): https://youtu.be/8p6KvK3AZ5M- "Number of the Chair" (2005): https://youtu.be/ErVU4PDHRD4
Pedagogy projects:- Workshop "The World of Metaphors": https://youtu.be/geDXGU49y4Y- Workshop "Movement as the Starting Point": https://youtu.be/_89StTHIZGo
- Photos: https://www.flickr.com/photos/132070765@N04/
 
The support we need: 
We are due to perform the finished piece in this December 2019 at the Espace Beaujon, in Paris, France. We are 6 people on the stage (5 performers and one musician). We are looking for financial support to fully develop the piece and give it the quality it deserves. So we can give it back to the community. 
All funding collected in this platform will serve to pay the artists involved. We are searching for other funding opportunities and we are waiting for a couple of answers, from supporters such as the Ville de Paris and Spedidam.
As an exchange you will be added to the priority list of the company, having your name on the programme of the show, on the website and social media pages of the company, getting free tickets to see shows and participate in workshops, as well as other special treats such as a meal with the team or following the process live.
 

The Impact
Your support will contribute to the making of the show and to paying a fare fee to the artists. For us, it will be a present and an encouragement to keep doing what we do. For the community, it will be a way of sharing, meeting and celebrating live relationships.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Help us also getting the word out (loud), making some noise about our project. Sharing with your friends, family members and people you may think could be interested.
 
THANK YOU SO MUCH !
 
 
(en français)
Le Projet
Porté par la compagnie parisienne, Fool's Cap Theatre, dirigé par le chorégraphe et interprète brésilien, Vinicius Carvalho, le projet "Attachés" est né d'une recherche sur l'expression du corps et sur des éléments fondamentaux du mouvement. L’objectif est de créer un spectacle de 80 minutes alliant danse, théâtre, mime et dépassant nos frontières culturelles.
L’équipe est composée de cinq interprètes, un musicien, un régisseur lumière, un costumier, un artiste vidéaste et une équipe administrative, tous issus de milieux artistiques et culturels différents (France, Brésil, Royaume-Uni, Colombie et Italie).La pièce sera jouée en décembre 2019 à Paris et fera une tournée internationale en 2020/2021.Malgré tout, nous avons besoin de votre soutien!
 
Le spectacle
"Attachés" - pièce (en cours de création)Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&t=7s
Sur scène, cinq corps se rencontrent pour explorer individuellement, en couple, en trio, et en groupe, le thème de l’attachement. L’attachement à l’autre, à une habitude, à un objet, à une mémoire, à une religion, à un amour. La peur d'être seul ou l'inconfort de ne "rien faire", génère en nous l'impulsion de regarder autour de nous et de nouer des relations avec le monde. Ce mécanisme n'est ni mauvais ni bon, cela fait partie de notre condition humaine. Nous créons souvent nos dieux: dieu-mariage, dieu-argent, dieu-travail, dieu-alcool, dieu-croyances, dieu-portable ...Bien que cela fasse partie de notre nature humaine de "besoin" des choses et des personnes, nous savons profondément que, à un moment donné, nous pouvons toutes les perdre. Ensuite, nous devrons trouver un moyen de vivre sans eux. En ce moment, nous commençons à nous interroger sur la nature de notre bonheur et sur ce dont nous avons vraiment besoin. Ensuite, nous pourrons peut-être travailler de l’autre côté de la médaille: le détachement de nos besoins.

Igor&Moreno) (Italy)* 2 au 12 décembre 2019 : répétition à la Ménagerie de Verre, à Paris* 12 et 13 décembre 2019 : Avant-première au Espace Beaujon à Paris

L'impact

Igor & Moreno) (Itália)* 2 de 12 de dezembro de 2019: ensaios na Ménagerie de Verre, à Paris* 12 e 13 de dezembro de 2019: Pré-estréia no Espace Beaujon à Paris
 
Coreografia e dramaturgia Vinicius Carvalho, em colaboração com Barbara Mangano
Performers criadoresBarbara Mangano, Danilo Sekic, Liane Masson, Marianna Cifarelli e Vinicius CarvalhoParte do processo criativo: Chiara Capitani e Elena Michelin
Criação músicaAlex Paton
Photo, vídeoCarmen Rozzonelli
ProduçãoFool’s Cap Theatre e Culturelles Production
 
A Companhia
Fool's Cap Theatre
website: www.foolscaptheatre.comFool's Cap Theatre é uma companhia internacional de artes performáticas fundada em 2015. Recentemente re-locada de Londres para Paris, a companhia apresentou seus trabalhos pela Europa, Brasil, Índia e Coréia. Normalmente, trabalhamos com um grupo multicultural de artistas, pois é assim como gostamos de trabalhar e como acreditamos poder criar algo mais abrangente e rico. Combinamos criação e pedagogia com base no trabalho de grupo e na pesquisa do movimento.
Algumas críticas sobre o trabalho são:
“Um balé de vida colorida, divertido e cheio de esperança!” (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)
"... Encantador" (Reviews Gate)
"... um deleite visual" (The Times of India)
“Fascinante, para dizer o mínimo” (Telangana Today)
"... ovação de pé e aplausos intermináveis do público" (The Times of India)
Nossos parceiros: Já juntamos importantes parceiros, como European Cultural Foundation; the Danish Arts Foundation; the Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne, La Ménagerie de Verre; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; Espace Beaujon e Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).
 
Outros projetos da companhia: - "Timing" (2017): https://youtu.be/CPWjOQhP0do- "The Unparalleled Adventure of One Hans Pfaall" (2016): https://youtu.be/dz9lD5qxBeo- "Streets of Frequency" (2014): https://youtu.be/8p6KvK3AZ5M- "Number of the Chair" (2005): https://youtu.be/ErVU4PDHRD4
Pedagogy projects:- Workshop "The World of Metaphors": https://youtu.be/geDXGU49y4Y- Workshop "Movement as the Starting Point": https://youtu.be/_89StTHIZGo
- Photos: https://www.flickr.com/photos/132070765@N04/

O suporte de que precisamos:
Apresentaremos a peça finalizada em dezembro de 2019 no Espace Beaujon, em Paris, França. Somos 6 pessoas no palco (5 atores-bailarinos e um músico). Estamos à procura de apoio financeiro para desenvolver plenamente a peça e dar-lhe a qualidade que merece. E assim devolvê-la à comunidade.
Todo o financiamento coletado nesta plataforma servirá para pagar os artistas envolvidos. Estamos à procura de outras oportunidades de financiamento e estamos à espera de algumas respostas de apoiadores, como a Ville de Paris e a Spedidam. 
Como troca, você será adicionado(a) à lista de prioritária da companhia, tendo seu nome no programa da peça, no site e nas páginas de mídia social da companhia, recebendo ingressos gratuitos para ver espetáculos e participar de workshops, bem como outros tratamentos especiais, como uma refeição com a equipe e seguir o processo criativo ao vivo.
 
O impacto
Seu apoio contribuirá para a realização do espetáculo e para o pagamento de um cachê digno aos artistas. Para nós, será um presente e um incentivo para continuarmos fazendo o que fazemos. Para a comunidade, será uma maneira de compartilhar, se conhecer e celebrar o encontro ao vivo.
 
Outras maneiras de ajudar
Ajude-nos a espalhar a notícia, fazendo um "auê" sobre o nosso projeto. Compartilhando com seus amigos, familiares e pessoas que você acha que poderiam estar interessadas.
 
MUITO OBRIGADO !
 
 
(en italiano)
La compagnia
 
Fool's Cap Theatre,  siamo una compagnia internazionale fondata nel 2014 a Londra. Trasferiti a Parigi di recente, giriamo con i nostri spettacoli in Europe, Brasile, India e Corea. Amiamo lavorare con un equipe di artisti multiculturali perché crediamo nella ricchezza portata dalla diversità. Portiamo avanti un lavoro di creazione e pedagogia basato su una ricerca sul movimento. 
Alcune critiche sul lavoro: 
« Un ballet de vie colorée, ludique et plein d'espoir! » (THEATRE ACTU - Festival Mimesis 2017)
«... Spellbinding » (Reviews Gate)
«... un régal visuel » (The Times of India)
« Hypnotisant, c'est le moins qu'on puisse dire » (Telangana Today)
«... ovation debout et applaudissements éternels du public » (The Times of India)
 
Lo spettacolo
"Attachés" é il terzo progetto della compagnia, in creazione dal 2017.
(https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EhHI-r7IlBM&amp...)
Sulla scena cinque corpi s'incontrano per esplorare individualmente, in coppia, in trio e in gruppo il tema dell'attaccamento. L'attaccamento all'altro, a un'abitudine, ad un oggetto, alla memoria, alla religione , all'amore. Partendo da una ricerca coreografica sul movimento, Attachés si presenta come uno studio sul linguaggio, cercando un cammino possibile tra la danza e il teatro gestuale.
Le nostre collaborazioni: Abbiamo già il sostegno di European Cultural Foundation; la fondazione Danish Arts Foundation; le Centre National de la Danse; La Briqueterie CDCN du Val de Marne ; La Ménagerie de Verre ; S'ALA (Igor & Moreno); l'Odin Teatret Nordisk teaterlaboratorium; l'Espace Beaujon et le Collectif des Arts du Mime et du Geste (3e Biennale).
 
Il sostegno di cui abbiamo bisogno
Presenteremo lo spettacolo in dicembre à l'Espace Beaujon, à Pargi, in Francia. Siamo 6 persone sulla scena, cinque performers e un musicista. Cerchiamo un aiuto economico per sviluppare pienamente lo spettacolo e dargli la qualità che merita, per poterlo poi offrire al pubblico .
I soldi raccolti attraverso questa piattaforfa servirano a pagare gli artisi. Stiamo cercando altre fonti di finanziamento e aspettiamo delle risposte dal Comune di Parigi e dalla Spedidam.
In cambio del vostro aiuto : Il vostro nome figurerà nel programma di spettacolo, sul sito internet e sulle pagine dei socialnetwork della compagnia, riceverete dei biglietti gratuiti per assistere a degli spettacoli o partecipare a degli laboratori della compagnia e ci saranno altri regali possibili come per esempio un pranzo o una cena con la compagnia.
 
L'impatto del vostro aiuto
Il vostro sostegno contribuirà alla realizzazione dello spettacolo e al pagamento degli artisti. Per noi sarà un regalo e un incoraggiamento per continuare ad avanzare nel nostro progetto. Per tutti voi sarà una maniera di condividere il nostro lavoro e incontrarci di persona.
 
Altre maniere tramite le quali potete aiutarci
Aiutateci a diffondere questo messaggio e parlate del nostro progetto intorno a voi. Condividetelo con amici, famiglia e con le persone che pensate possano essere interessate a sostenerlo.
 
Grazie !

story:
Overview

 

Good ladies, gentlefolk and filthy peasants I bring glad tidings of Game of Thrones: The Pantomime! After our smash hit sell out run in Norwich we need your help to take our show to the next level, beyond the wall, to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2020.

 

Quintuple L is a new theatre company formed by former UEA students as the result of a conversation at a drunken house party that went too far. After a successful run of our first show ‘Game of Thrones: The Pantomime’ in Norwich we want to take our fabulously funny and viciously violent pantomime to Edinburgh.

 

We also want to use the Edinburgh Fringe as a launching pad for our company to put on further shows in Norfolk and across the country, providing opportunities for young people in the Norwich area to get involved in exciting, original theatre.

 

Game of Thrones: The Pantomime

 

Written by King Joffrey himself (with his recently executed ghostwriter Sam Went) Game of Thrones: The Pantomime tells the true story of the first season of the hit TV show untainted by Season 8. Or even Seasons 2 through 7.

 

Marvel as the gallant and handsome King Joffrey fights to secure his rightful throne! Aww as he woos the beautiful Lady Sansa Stark! Boo and hiss at the dastardly villainous schemes of Ned Stark! Shout “He’s behind you!” as Ned’s useless henchman, Littlefinger, sneaks up on our fair heroes! Ignore the liars who say the sexy Queen Cersei is just a hairy man in a dress!

 

Game of Thrones: The Pantomime is an original parody of the popular book series and TV show re-imagining the story as a traditional pantomime as told by King Joffrey Baratheon.

 

What We Need

 

We’re looking for your help to raise £1000 to get our show to the 2020 Edinburgh Fringe Festival.

 

Instead of spending your donations on wine and women the majority of this money will be spent on our venue, which based on our research should cost us around £2000 for our two week run.

 

While our priority is our venue (because performing outside in Scotland sounds cold) we will also be using your generous donations to pay our fringe joining fee, create props and costumes and print posters and flyers to market our show. So, the more money we can raise the better our show will look.

 

Any additional money we raise will be used to finance previous in Norfolk and London, we’ve budgeted these previews at £300 each.

 

We hope to recoup the majority of our budget in ticket sales at the fringe and then use that money for Quintupple L to put on more original shows around the Norfolk area. This means that by donating to Game of Thrones: The Pantomime your money could echo in laughter for years to come.

 

What You Get

 

In supporting Game of Thrones: The Pantomime you will be helping to bring a fantastically funny original pantomime to the Edinburgh Fringe and provide a better ending to the franchise than Season 8 managed. But that’s not all!

 

In addition to tickets to our show in Edinburgh or the preview of their choice our backers will have access to a variety of Game of Thrones: The Pantomime goodies like personalised thank yous from the character of your choice, signed copies of the script or even dinner with the cast!

 

Please check out our perks to see what takes your fancy.

 

Risks

 

When producing anything related to Game of Thrones the biggest risk is that we’ll abandon the project early to go make a series of Star Wars movies that we’ll then abandon when Netflix drives a lorry full of money to our house.

 

But, assuming that doesn’t happen, there is the risk we won’t be able to secure a venue in Edinburgh. While we think this risk is small, if it does happen, we will still perform the show around Norwich and London while preparing for Edinburgh 2021.

 

There’s also the risk of cast or crew dropping out at the last minute, however we have experience of dealing with this having faced this issue with our original Norwich production. In this case after a call out on social media we were quickly able to recast and keep our show on schedule.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you aren’t able to contribute to our campaign or want to do even more to make Game of Thrones: The Pantomime a success then there are other ways you can help us.

 

Please follow our social media accounts:

 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/GoTPantomime/?modal=ad...

Twitter: https://twitter.com/quintuple_l

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/quintuplelproductions/

Website: https://quintuplelproductions.weebly.com/

Raven: Various locations, as is the nature of ravens.

 

And share our posts to get the word out as far and wide as we possibly can. You can also buy tickets to our show in Edinburgh or to one of our previews.

Or if you’re feeling dramatic why not audition for Game of Thrones: The Pantomime in December?

 

 

On behalf of the cast, crew and everyone at Quintupple L thank you for all of your kind support.

story:
Who We Are

“Hexentanz” in German means “witches’ dance,” and we bring the spellbinding, subversive power of the witch to our modern-day spin on classic vaudeville. Spearheaded by choreographer and burlesque performer Vexy Minx, the Cabaret fuses golden-era burlesque and belly dancing with cutting-edge neo-burlesque, song-and-dance production numbers, circus arts, and sideshow to create an immersive nightlife experience. Featuring an all-star cast of some of New York City’s finest nightlife entertainers, we bring vaudeville back to life with a modern, diverse, feminist twist.

We Need Your Help

We are thrilled to bring the Hexentanz Cabaret to the Slipper Room for a third time, but we need your help. We have set a goal of $1000 to offset expenses before we debut our biggest, most magical show yet. With the help of our incredible and supportive community we know we can make it a reality. These funds will help us create unique costumes, props, and music, and in addition to securing rehearsal space for our production numbers. We want to bring you the full, live vaudeville experience you deserve so you are dancing in your seat!

Your Impact

Your contribution helps us bring some of the best and brightest in New York nightlife to our stage for original numbers you cannot and will not see anywhere else! Helping us cover these costs enables us to continue to combine the talents of our incredible variety community by ensuring compensation for all involved, high-quality music and costumes, rehearsal space and time, and the advertising to make our shows a success and continue to produce more in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hard up at the moment? Got the cold, hard, cash blues? Hey, we understand! You can still help us make this show a success by SHARING our IndieGoGo, following and sharing @TheHexentanzCabaret on Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube, and just SPREADING THE WORD any way you know how! A dream is a wish your heart makes, and we know when all our dreams are combined, that wish can come true. We thank you for all your support!

story:
Ari Rudenko here, founder and artistic director of Prehistoric Body Theater (prehistoricbody.org).  We are a paleontology-inspired cross-cultural performance company based between my hometown Seattle (USA) and Bali (Indonesia), where I have been working since 2012.  Ghosts of Hell Creek is Prehistoric Body Theater's main-stage theater experience, which immerses audiences in an epic tale of our evolutionary ancestors, and how they survived the apocalyptic asteroid impact which ended the reign of the dinosaurs.  The story is brought to life on stage through the evocative use of layered clay makeup and set installation, hypnotic lighting, and organic bass-heavy sound design.

    Ghosts of Hell Creek has been built in prototype stages under mentorship with leading paleontologists and in collaboration with a dynamic community of Indonesian dancers.   By working cross-culturally with Indonesian artists, Prehistoric Body Theater opens an unprecedented conversation between science and world culture on the nature of our human identity and origins.   Now, I am laying the groundwork to bring Ghosts of Hell Creek on tour internationally out of Bali, featuring a unique ensemble of dancers from Java, Bali, Borneo, Papua, and beyond.

     After years of prototyping, it's time to build the final world-class touring version of Ghosts of Hell Creek!  To raise the piece to its full potential, we need a deep and sustained rehearsal phase with the dancers to develop an even stronger and more intricate choreography.  We also need administrative resources to manage tour development.  Moreover, our team comes from all over Indonesia, so we need a central hub from which to manage the project.  This is Prehistoric Body Launchpad!

     We need your support to build the Launchpad!   Your generous $25,000 will fund: 

         - Renting a residency house in Bali to serve as a communal living space and office for Prehistoric Body Theater   

         - Paid rehearsals for the dancers and team in preparation for touring 

         - Fees for administrative staff and services         

         - Final props and set design
 

WHAT IS GHOSTS OF HELL CREEK?

     66 million years ago, a massive asteroid struck the Earth with the force of a billion atomic bombs.  Ghosts of Hell Creek tells the terrifying tale of Acheroraptor, the last magnificently feathered raptor dinosaur who prowled the Hell Creek flood-jungles of prehistoric Montana before her total annihilation in the ensuing apocalyptic mass extinction.   Ghosts of Hell Creek then tells the miraculous survival story of Purgatorius, our ancient primate ancestor who rose from the ashes of the asteroid impact, and thrived on the first fruit as the world was born anew.

     I researched for Ghosts of Hell Creek under mentorship with leading paleontologists, including Hell Creek Project director Dr. Greg Wilson.  In 2017, we won the Bergstrom Award for Art-Science Interface, a significant grant which supported my extended research process with the scientists.  As the artist-in-residence at Hell Creek, I worked alongside the paleontologists to unearth the bones of Tyrannosaurus rex, Triceratops, and our star Acheroraptor.   I got more than a crash course in the scientific process, I also had a powerful spiritual and artistic connection with the very real world of our performance's story.  

     Ghosts of Hell Creek has been developed through three prototype stages, first as an experimental film shot in Indonesia (available for all backers who pledge over $25!), second as a live stage show in Seattle with a diverse USA-based cast, and third as a 2019 live performance series and intensive residency in Bali.

     For a detailed description of the performance, its history, and collaboration with paleontologists, visit www.prehistoricbody.org/about and open the link to the Oxford University Press article "Prehistoric Body Theater: bringing paleontology narratives to global contemporary performance audiences."  

OUR TEAM

Director: Ari Rudenko
Assistant Director: Sofyan Joyo Utomo
Dancers: Abu Grey Lobubun, Aji Dukun, Akbar W, Alan ilunD, Alfo Smith, Bagus Pulung Tilamas, Boy Mahmudi, Erwin Mardiansyah, Jasmine Okubo, Jiaqi Kyki Li, Krisna Satya, Mekratingrum Hapsari, Natasha Rafizi, Putri Wartawati, Selvinia Yunita, Tengku Arre Syarifah, Tio Kipli, Tyoba Bond
Lighting Design: Peter Bracilano, Aji Sangiaji
Music and Sound Composers: Mo’ong Santoso Pribadi, Ari Rudenko
Production Assistants: Akbar W, Trina Acacia
Director of Photography: Muhammad Fauzy Chaniago
Director of Videography: Dibal Ranuh, Andre Triadiputra 

Visit the Ghosts of Hell Creek ARCHIVE for full credits and photo gallery

-

For questions and comments, please message Ari Rudenko at arirudenko (at) prehistoricbody (dot) org.
