story:
A Monologue from Our Founder

During these uncertain times, the theater and arts community came together to find ways to keep the arts alive and relevant. With the current circumstances, artists are faced with many challenges one being technology. Technology offers a wealth of information and opportunities, but it also has its draw backs. Knowing this, this brings us to the question of “How do we create LIVE theater virtually”. 

I’ve thought about ways I could continue to spread the joy of theater from the comforts of our homes.  I’ve also looked into possibilities to potentially provide jobs to not only to actors, but to all artist involved in creating the works you normally would see on stage. With new and current technologies, I was able to find a way to bring a live experience to a virtual audience. 

With many late-night phone calls, hours on zoom, crazy technological experiments, and a plethora of passion, I present to you Morpheus Productions Company LLC. MPC’s aim is to transform live theater. My team and I are excited to share a new way to experience theater. I am so thankful and blessed to have a team so talented and dedicated to keeping the arts alive. Without them, this would have not come to fruition.

As the world changes, Morpheus Productions Company LLC will continue to transform with it.  

 

Our Mission

Morpheus Productions Company LLC’s mission is to transform live theatre and inspire theatre artists and audiences. We aim to produce published musical theatre pieces as well as workshop and facilitate new work. In conjunction with our theatrical productions, Morpheus Productions Company LLC will offer a consulting service to help theatre artists, companies, and educational departments create innovative virtual productions. In a time where the theatre world is at a standstill, Morpheus Productions Company LLC aims to provide opportunities and jobs for all theatre artists, on and off the stage.

 

What We Need

Goal: Get our theatre company up and running and to obtain performance rights. 

Goal Amount: $3000

  • Our first goal is to raise enough to cover performance rights and maintain a domain. 
  • Our second goal is to offer compensation to our artists for their time and talents and acquiring the proper equipment required to produce live virtual theatre.
  • Our third goal is to work towards non-profit status.
     

Our Impact

As stated in our story above, the spark that ignited our fire to come together and start a production company was the impact that COVID-19 has had on artists across the country and globe. Our Founder, Kara Leigh, made it a mission to create job opportunities at a time when the theatre world was standing still. Supporting our company will first and foremost give us the ability to hire artists to work on innovative theatre productions. Everyone involved with our company and productions have volunteered to make this a reality. The funding from this campaign will help us grow and register our company so that we can properly compensate the artists that we collaborate with.

Our theatre platform has the power to transform live theatre as we know it. As a virtual theatre company, we have the unique ability to work with artists from around the world. Location will no longer limit our productions as all of our rehearsals and performances are completely virtual.  
 

Risks & Challenges

How do you produce live musicals online?

  • As a company at the forefront of the virtual theatre industry, we have utilized different technologies in order to bring you live theatre in the comfort and safety of your homes. We continue to experiment with various platforms as new technology is developed every day in hopes of improving our platform.

Connecting with our community virtually

  • Now more than ever, it is important for us to stay connected with each other. In hard times, people have historically turned to art as a way of escaping the realities that they are living in. Art, and more specifically theatre, allows audience members to connect with the artists themselves as well as with the strangers sitting beside them. So, how can we create this connection without physically sharing a space? This is a question that drives our innovation and passion with Morpheus Productions Company LLC. We strive to give you the same experience as if you were sitting in a theatre and watching the production. Streaming our live productions virtually will allow for a greater shared experience among the community that has formed.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any amount will help but we understand some people may not be able to donate money. You can still help Morpheus Productions Company LLC by:

  • Sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family
  • Following us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter
  • Visiting our website https://morpheusproductions.wixsite.com/home

Without them, this would have not come to fruition.
As the world changes, Morpheus Productions Company LLC will continue to transform with it.   Our Mission
Morpheus Productions Company LLC’s mission is to transform live theatre and inspire theatre artists and audiences. We aim to produce published musical theatre pieces as well as workshop and facilitate new work. In conjunction with our theatrical productions, Morpheus Productions Company LLC will offer a consulting service to help theatre artists, companies, and educational departments create innovative virtual productions. In a time where the theatre world is at a standstill, Morpheus Productions Company LLC aims to provide opportunities and jobs for all theatre artists, on and off the stage. What We Need
Goal: Get our theatre company up and running and to obtain performance rights. 
Goal Amount: $3000

Our first goal is to raise enough to cover performance rights and maintain a domain. 
Our second goal is to offer compensation to our artists for their time and talents and acquiring the proper equipment required to produce live virtual theatre.
Our third goal is to work towards non-profit status. 

Our Impact
As stated in our story above, the spark that ignited our fire to come together and start a production company was the impact that COVID-19 has had on artists across the country and globe. Our Founder, Kara Leigh, made it a mission to create job opportunities at a time when the theatre world was standing still. Supporting our company will first and foremost give us the ability to hire artists to work on innovative theatre productions. Everyone involved with our company and productions have volunteered to make this a reality. The funding from this campaign will help us grow and register our company so that we can properly compensate the artists that we collaborate with.
Our theatre platform has the power to transform live theatre as we know it. As a virtual theatre company, we have the unique ability to work with artists from around the world. Location will no longer limit our productions as all of our rehearsals and performances are completely virtual.   
Risks & Challenges
How do you produce live musicals online?
As a company at the forefront of the virtual theatre industry, we have utilized different technologies in order to bring you live theatre in the comfort and safety of your homes. We continue to experiment with various platforms as new technology is developed every day in hopes of improving our platform.
Connecting with our community virtually
Now more than ever, it is important for us to stay connected with each other. In hard times, people have historically turned to art as a way of escaping the realities that they are living in. Art, and more specifically theatre, allows audience members to connect with the artists themselves as well as with the strangers sitting beside them. So, how can we create this connection without physically sharing a space? This is a question that drives our innovation and passion with Morpheus Productions Company LLC. We strive to give you the same experience as if you were sitting in a theatre and watching the production. Streaming our live productions virtually will allow for a greater shared experience among the community that has formed. Other Ways You Can Help
Any amount will help but we understand some people may not be able to donate money. You can still help Morpheus Productions Company LLC by:

Sharing our Indiegogo campaign with your friends and family
Following us on Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter
Visiting our website https://morpheusproductions.wixsite.com/home

story:
Syndicate Theater Group is a versatile group of international actors located in NYC committed to bringing engaging and powerful performances to all forms of theater. We are committed to diversity, inclusion, and acceptance of all artists, messages, ideas and forms of art. Our very first project as a theater company is Miguel Piñero's "Short Eyes". Short Eyes is a powerful and compelling play of a group of everyday convicts who deal with the arrival of a new prisoner who is accused of being a child rapist.

We chose this particular play as our first project because we feel that this play, although it was written in 1974, speaks on many controversial subjects that are part of the national conversation today. It touches so many realistic situations that affect so many including racism, homosexuality, drug abuse, friendship, the prison system, seclusion, rape, child endangerment, love, and morality... amongst others. It gives a powerful voice in such a diverse manner to all these things in the form of comedy, suspense, drama, etc. It truly is a timeless play that is rarely done and we, as artists and members of this theater company, feel the urge and responsibility to tell this incredible story by Miguel Piñero and to share it with you all so you also may experience the power of this story in the way that we did.

Your contributions to this campaign will give us the opportunity to tell this magnificent story, bring our theater company to life and to honor the legacy of Mr. Piñero. We humbly ask for you to donate what you can and if you can’t, you can always help us by spreading the word. Help us tell the story you want to see.


WHAT WE NEED:

We need to raise funds in order to pay for theater space for the event, acquisition of rights, insurance, production expenses, marketing, artists stipends and more. The breakdown is as follows: 

•$6400 Theater Rental- 2 weeks

•$2000 Performance Royalties & Rights Acquisition

•$1000 Insurance Policy 

•$8000 Production Expenses (Lighting, Sound, design, costumes, etc.)

•$1000 Marketing and Print Expenses


We have several exciting rewards to offer, so please check out the PERKS section!! 

 Let’s share this wonderful experience together! If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please spread the word by following us on any of our social media pages and follow and like us! Tell all your family members and friends. You won’t regret it!!! Also, we can use the help of volunteers. If interested, please feel free to contact us for more information. Enjoy this journey with us and enjoy the show. Let's make this happen!!! #ShortEyes2016


Follow & like us:

Facebook.com/ShortEyesPlay

Instagram /ShortEyes2016

Twitter@ShortEyes2016 

Or click on any of the links below:

story:
Our Cambodian choreographers have been developing into pioneers in Cambodian contemporary dance. 

Before now, they have only ever been able to access artistic full-time training opportunities abroad and have only had the resources to create dance pieces to an initial stage. Cambodia's artistic climate currently lacks the space, funds and resources for them to bring this work to completion.

We want to change this.

With your support, in 2016 we will create our first full-time 3 month residency in Cambodia, especially for the next generation of Cambodian choreographers: 3 months of training, collaboration, rehearsals and nurturing. 

With this opportunity to be fully immersed in the creative process, our artists will be at the forefront of exploring and defining the evolution of Cambodian contemporary dance.

We are Amrita Performing Arts (Amrita), one of the leading performing arts organizations in Cambodia. With a dance company of 17 classically trained Cambodian artists, as well as a strong production team, we produce works of  contemporary dance and theater that tour nationally and internationally. 

Our unique approach to skills development focuses on long-term capacity building of  Cambodian artists and arts professionals as they become pioneers in the arts sector in  Cambodia.

Following years of nurturing through our ongoing Artist Development Program, our artists are now beginning to emerge as pioneers in contemporary Cambodian choreography; creating new, ground-breaking work that reflects their experience of modern Cambodia.

The last twelve years of creative and considered investment has enabled us to create a sustainable, long-term foundation for our young Cambodian artists and arts  professionals to develop in this sector. 

Now, once again, we find ourselves at a point where we are challenged to match the growth of our artists with opportunities that can fully support them to reach their creative potential. Our investment has led us to a stage in which we need to bring our artist to the next level as they look to bringing their own Cambodian contemporary works to the world. 

CAMBODIAN LEADERSHIP

"CHOREOGRAPHY FOR ME IS NOT ONLY ABOUT MAKING DANCE, IT'S ALSO...TO QUESTION ONESELF AND TO QUESTION THE THINGS THAT ONE HAS NEVER ASKED BEFORE." 

                                                                           -  Chankethya Chey , Artistic Director

Both our Executive Director, Rithisal Kang (Sal), and Artistic Director, Chankethya Chey (Kethya), developed their early arts careers as arts manager and dancer/choreographer respectively through Amrita. After years of nurturing, they both received Fulbright Scholarships with additional support from the Asian Cultural Council (ACC) to study in the US, both the first Cambodian Fulbright scholars in their field of study. 

Their stories demonstrates the inbuilt culture within Amrita for sustainable capacity building at all levels. We believe this culture is reflective of the trajectory of development trends in Cambodia today, and something that underpins all our activities.

In this way, Amrita is working to nurture the next leaders in arts, culture and choreography.  

“IF DANCE TRULY IS THE LANGUAGE OF THE SOUL, CONTEMPORARY CAMBODIA IS HAVING A GLOBAL CONVERSATION ”

                                                                                         -Cassandra Naji, The Advisor

In response to our artists' desire for space, mentorship and resources to be able to realize their own creative visions, in 2013 we launched our first Contemporary Dance Platform, a six week experience, in which we commissioned our artists to create new work.

The Platform offered a safe and nurturing space in which Cambodian choreographers could challenge their own social and artistic sensibilities in creating new works. These cutting edge works tackled head on crucial topics such as power-struggles, mental health,  relationships, women’s rights and much more.

Now, three years on, we are moving to the next step. Building on the work of the Contemporary Dance Platform, we are looking to support our artists to take their choreography even further. 

The Choreographic Residency we are planning to launch in 2016 will provide a more profound creative experience for the artists to continue heightening their choreographic capacity and artistic leadership.

This residency will be an immersive 3-month program for 3 choreographers and 6 dancers. Led by our Artistic Leadership team, we will provide the studio space, funds and resources for our artists to work as full-time choreographers: only concentrating on the creative process. For the first time in their own country, our artists will have the tools to fully realize their creative visions and gain enormous artistic development in the process.

Over the three months our Artistic Leadership Team will design a bespoke, intensive curriculum of choreographic workshops, research topics and classes, tailored to the creative drives and needs of the participants. 

We will also be inviting international and local experts to collaborate and give workshops on areas such as dramaturgy, lighting design, music composition, in which our artists wish to develop. Ultimately, these three months will hugely increase our artists creative and professional potential as they look to the building their future careers as choreographers.

CHOREOGRAPHY, COMPLETED.

Throughout the three months, our artists will receive individual mentoring whilst they experiment on and rehearse their works-in-progress to completion. 

We anticipate that by the end of three months, our artists will have had the time, mentoring and resources to complete their original choreography. 

With a new repertoire of cutting-edge Cambodian contemporary pieces, we will then look to tour internationally.

Amrita is incorporated in the United States as a 501(c)3 not-for-profit organization and contributions are tax-deductible for US tax payers.

As an international NGO, our income comes from a combination of private donations and  money we generate from our production work. This will not cover the costs of this program.

Your support will go to:

Artist payment

We believe in valuing our artists as creative professionals, not just as performers. The main bulk of these  funds will go towards supporting our artists financially for three months.

Studio space

Appropriate space to rehearse, workshop, create and experiment is limited in Cambodia. We want to rent out a creative space for three months that our artists can fully inhabit with their rehearsals and workshops.

Production costs

Not only does this allow for our artists to create more exciting, ambitious work, but it also supports other local arts professionals. This includes; providing a budget for hiring local costume designers, musicians, prop materials.

Sharing our work

Our dream is that this residency will not only develop our artists, but present an opportunity to share Cambodian contemporary dance with the local community. Your contribution will enable us to hold workshops, talks, screenings and a final weekend showcase right here in Cambodia in which our audience can see the  results of the three month creative process.

FLEXIBLE FUNDING

All funds received will go towards the opportunity for our artists to complete their work; if we do not reach our goal, the funds will still enable us to provide space for our artists to work on their choreography.

The more funds we have, the bigger we can make this. More artists, more experts, more public talks, more performances and more opportunities for new choreography to be completed.

Your support is essential for this to happen.

We are offering some exciting perks that enable you to join us in supporting the next generation of Cambodian artists. In return for you support we're offering the unique chance to learn about Cambodian dance, gain exclusive photos and t-shirts, as well as see our artists in action.

GIVE WHAT YOU CAN.
SPREAD THE WORD.
SUPPORT CAMBODIA'S CHOREOGRAPHERS.

If you want to know more about Amrita Performing Arts, please see our website and/or our 2014-2015 Annual Report.

Or kun chrern (Thank you).

Images courtesy of Roly Touch, Anders Jiras, Chih Yu Lin, & ArtcomArt.

story:
The Skinny

Last year with your help we created a fabulously successful show. This year we're blowing it up and TAKING IT ON TOUR.

  • Part sexy cabaret, part hilarious cooking show
  • Live '70s soul band
  • Renowned chocolate dessert created on stage then given to the audience
  • Actors, dancers and musicians (in tight pants)
  • A completely unique and proven entertainment concept

Tour Dates

We're so excited. If you're anywhere near these fine places, you must come join the fun:

  • Feb 3-4-5: Crush Lounge, Whitefish, MT
  • Feb 7: The Triple Door, Seattle, WA
  • Feb 12: Myrna Loy Center, Helena, MT
  • Feb 13-14: Top Hat Lounge, Missoula, MT
We're potentially adding more as we go...

What's Involved

We'll be touring with fifteen incredibly talented artists. That's a lot. And EVERY PENNY RAISED GOES TO TAKE CARE OF THE ARTISTS:

  • Travel
  • Housing
  • Food
  • Pay
  • Hookers & Blow
  • Rebuilding hotel rooms after we trash them
Your contribution goes directly to these people. We've already got the "stuff" taken care of from the original production. Now we need to step up and take care of the important part -- the PEOPLE.

The Impact

Supporting this show is about supporting innovation in entertainment. Think of unique experiences out there and how they got started (Blue Man Group, Stomp, etc). 

  • Exposing this work to broader audiences provides a launching pad for ONGOING PRODUCTIONS and employment for many artists who rely on gigs for a living.
  • Missoula is becoming a destination for entertainers to bring their work, but this will allow Missoula to EXPORT its show to other cities and show the region what we're capable of. 

Risks & Challenges

We'll be partnering with bakeries in 4 cities, traveling through the mountains in February, coordinating 15 people's schedules, housing and feeding them all. It won't be easy. But:

  • Everyone involved has tour experience.
  • We have many connections in each city we're touring to -- so we have a head start on selling the shows.
  • The less time we spend on fundraising, the more time we can spend on making the show impeccable. 

Summary

It always feels good to help people you like. It should feel extra special knowing you're backing a successful show that's poised to raise a lot of eyebrows as well. THANK YOU for your contribution, and we'll see you at the show!

story:
BRELBY IS GOING PLACES! Help us make Downtown Glendale a destination for Culture, FUN AND ADVENTURE. 

You can help Brelby bring engaging adventurous art to the West Valley!

Brelby Theatre Company is getting ready to embark on our adventurous 2015 Summer Season and we want you to be a part of it!  From Jo and her sisters fighting epic battles in their attic in "Little Women, The Broadway Musical", to The world premiere of “Fangirl”- a tale of a group of young adults striving to take the best cosplay award at Comicon,  to a brand new re-imagining of the Three Musketeers set in a dystopian future in, “Beyond Musketeers: Utopia Lost” - Brelby’s summer is action-packed!

What is Brelby?

Brelby Theatre has established itself as a vibrant member of the community and an incubator for exceptional live performances.  We’re taking off and we want you to be a part of the excitement!  Located in the heart of downtown Glendale, this energetic theatre company has something for everyone.  With us, theatre is not a spectator sport, but engages you from the moment you enter- from exciting stage combat to high-energy music and dance, you will be amazed at the professional quality performances brought to you at affordable prices all in the comfort of an intimate setting.  The momentum has been building and this is the year!  We have an action-packed summer planned and need your help to launch us into the stratosphere!


How Much do we need?

$10,000


Why do we need it?

Producing Theatre is a huge undertaking and isn’t possible without the support of our community. While we at Brelby are masters of making the most out of very little, we have some adventurous goals for our summer season and invite you to be an integral part of making them happen. 

Your contributions will enable us to:

  • Hold summer camps for children and teens

  • Produce “Beyond Musketeers: Utopia Lost” a high energy adaptation of the classic set in a dystopian future

  • Produce “Dotty Dot” a new children’s musical and then tour it to communities and groups that are underserved by the arts

  • Produce “Little Women, The Broadway Musical”

  • Produce the World Premier production of “Fangirl” a playful tribute to Geek culture and all things fandom

  • Produce the World Premier production of “Poseiden’s Regret” a magical adventure of revenge and reconciliation

  • Provide weekly Improv performances from our resident improv troupe Results May Vary

  • Provide opportunities for dozens of performers, designers, and artists


Other Ways you can help:

No amount is too small (or too big!), and every dollar helps, but we understand that making a donation is not possible for everyone. You can still be a huge help to us by simply spreading the word about our campaign and sharing our video on Facebook and Twitter. You can use the IndieGoGo share tools to make this easier. And check out our website to learn more about our company, members, workshops and productions:www.brelby.com . You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube. Thanks!


Thank you for your support!

Hold summer camps for children and teens
Produce “Beyond Musketeers: Utopia Lost” a high energy adaptation of the classic set in a dystopian future
Produce “Dotty Dot” a new children’s musical and then tour it to communities and groups that are underserved by the arts
Produce “Little Women, The Broadway Musical” 
Produce the World Premier production of “Fangirl” a playful tribute to Geek culture and all things fandom
Produce the World Premier production of “Poseiden’s Regret” a magical adventure of revenge and reconciliation
Provide weekly Improv performances from our resident improv troupe Results May Vary
Provide opportunities for dozens of performers, designers, and artists
Other Ways you can help:
No amount is too small (or too big!), and every dollar helps, but we understand that making a donation is not possible for everyone. You can still be a huge help to us by simply spreading the word about our campaign and sharing our video on Facebook and Twitter. You can use the IndieGoGo share tools to make this easier. And check out our website to learn more about our company, members, workshops and productions:www.brelby.com . You can also follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube. Thanks!
Thank you for your support!

story:
Held Momentarily 

Starring 

INDIA CARNEY (SEASON 8 NBC THE VOICE)

is now at NYMF!

heldmomentarilythemusical.com

Trapped on a stalled subway car, six strangers discover it's not just the train that's stuck. A poignant musical comedy about making connections, living in the moment and moving on in life. Oh, and one more thing: A woman just went into labor.

“Delivers comedy and riveting drama” - Time Out NY

“Comical yet unexpectedly poignant” - Curtain Up

“Musical comedy at its best” - The Villager

"I can't believe I made you" - Mom

Hi. We're Oliver and James, the writers of the new musical, Held Momentarily. Following a critically acclaimed run at the 2014 NY International Fringe Festival and extension at the Off-Broadway Fringe Encore series, a revised and reimagined production of Held Momentarily is pulling into the New York Musical Theatre Festival (NYMF) this summer! NYMF is a highly prestigious and selective platform, which has been a springboard for numerous Broadway and Off-Broadway productions, including Next to Normal and [title of show]. 

You guys, this is a REALLY BIG deal.

Get this train moving!

Participating in NYMF is an invaluable artistic and professional opportunity for all of the exciting up-and-coming artists involved in our production, ourselves included. But we need your help to make it happen.

All donations have the option of being tax deductible by going through NYMF instead of our IndieGoGo campaign. To make a tax deductible contribution, checks can be made payable to New York Musical Theater Festival with Held Momentarily in the subject line, mailed to the following address:

Attn: Cassie Lundgren

New York Musical Theater Festival

36 W 44th St, Ste 1010A

New York, NY 10036

(And shoot us an email at heldmomentarilythemusical@gmail.com to let us know!)

Our total budget is $46,750. That's a lot of money, but putting up a show at NYMF is expensive. We've raised $20,000 so far but still need to raise $26,750, and are hoping to raise as much as we can here. Some costs include:

  • Rehearsal and Performance Expenses
  • Physical Production (set, lights, props, costumes, etc)
  • Advertising and Promotion
  • Festival Participation Costs
  • Creative Staff Salaries
  • Administrative Fees
  • Complete the 2nd Avenue Subway line on time and on budget

The Impact

Held Momentarily is the result of the mingling of exciting new voices in musical theater. By supporting us you will:

  • Help bring a revised and revamped production of Held Momentarily back to the New York Stage.

  • Enable this incredible opportunity for the writers and performers, many of whom met while attending LaGuardia High School for the Performing Arts, the "Fame School." LaGuardia has bred the likes of countless major figures in the arts, including Al Pacino, Wesley Snipes, Adrien Brody, Danny Burstein, Vanessa Williams, Nicki Minaj, Emily Skeggs and recently Ansel Elgort, a friend of ours who came to our Fringe run! 

  • Leave feeling generally more at peace with train delays

Other Ways You Can Help

No cash? There are other ways to help! Give us a shout on Facebook and Instagram and let people know you're coming!

  • Get your tickets! 
  • Listen to the music
  • Like our page on Facebook and stay tuned for updates
  • Share our project on IndieGoGo
  • See more on our website

More About Us

Oliver Houser (Book, Music & Lyrics/Cal) is a writer, composer, actor and recent graduate of the Macaulay Honors Program at Hunter College, NY. His musical, Held Momentarily, ran at the 2014 NY International Fringe Festival, and was one of a small selection of shows chosen to participate in the Fringe’s Off-Broadway “Encores” series at the SoHo Playhouse. Tony-winning composer Bill Finn has showcased Oliver's work at Barrington Stage Company and 54 Below. Oliver’s short musical, "Preschool," was a finalist at the Festival of New American Musicals’ 2013 Show Search competition. His musical adaptation of Anton Chekhov's The Seagull debuted at the On the Verge Theater Festival in Glasgow, Scotland in 2014. Oliver is currently developing new work with the Musical Theatre Factory and is a member of the BMI musical theatre workshop.

James Zebooker (Additional Material/Greg) Held Momentarily is James' second collaboration with Oliver Houser He cowrote Preschool The Musical which was a Finalist at 2013 Festival of New American Musicals Show Search Los Angeles. As an actor he appeared in Held Momentarily Off-Broadway at the Soho Playhouse. He played Prince Carlos in Teatro SEA’s Cinderella, and Edna Turnblad in Hairspray at LaGuardia High School. He is a graduate of the Drama Department at LaGuardia. This summer he made his professional directorial debut at The Bushwick Starr adapting and performing in a work from author Thomas C. Wolfe's From Death to Mourning  as part of the Brooklyn Gypsies' ¡Oye! Avant-garde Night.

Harry Shifman (Director) Harry Shifman, SDC, is the senior member of the Drama faculty at LaGuardia High School for Music and Art & the Performing Arts, where he teaches acting and directs theatre. His productions span the theatrical gamut, and include the musicals Carousel, Urinetown, Cabaret, Hairspray, Les Misérables, and West Side Story, as well as plays including; A Midsummer Night’s Dream, The Hot L Baltimore, The House of Blue Leaves, The Rose Tattoo, and Othello. He is delighted and honored to play once again with some of his extraordinary former students. 

Hunter Bird (Creative Developer) Hunter currently serves as the Line Producer for the Johnny Mercer Writers Colony at Goodspeed Musicals and an Associate Director for The Debate Society. Hunter has directed at Ars Nova, The McKittrick Hotel, The New York Musical Theatre Festival, The NY International Fringe Festival, SoHo Playhouse, Joe's Pub, The Club at LaMaMa, Columbia University, and the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. www.hunter-bird.com

India Carney (Asherah) India is so honored to reunite with the cast and new friends for the revival of “Held Momentarily” at the New York Musical Theatre Festival! Following her television debut appearances on NBC “The Voice” Season 8, India graduated with distinction from The University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) earning her B.A. in Music and Music Industry Minor. India is an alumna of LaGuardia Arts and The Manhattan School of Music Precollege. She is a U.S. Presidential Scholar in the Arts and YoungArts Silver Winner in Voice, including Theater (Spoken & Musical). Partial Performance Listings - Off-Broadway: Held Momentarily (Lilith) at SoHo Playhouse, NYCFringe Encores. Other Theater Credits: Opera UCLA -Orpheus in the Underworld (Cybèle); LaGuardia Arts - A Chorus Line (Diana), Hairspray (Dynamite/Cindy); Manhattan School of Music - AIDA (Aida), Les Misèrables (Éponine)

Jordan Barrow (Stan) Jordan is excited to be back on this subway ride after performing in the NY Fringe Festival Encore Series production. Off-Broadway: The Tempest (NY Shakespeare Festival at the Delacorte Theater). Regional: Peter Pan and The Miracle Worker (Paper Mill Playhouse), Finian's Rainbow (Music Theatre Wichita). Workshops: Sweetie directed by Patricia Birch. He holds a BFA in Musical Theatre from the University of Michigan and studied at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art. Much love to his friends and family for all their support!

Ciaran Bowling (Liam) Ciaran is a new graduate from LaGuardia HS here in New York, and is thrilled to be the new passenger on board Held Momentarily. Off Broadway: Midsummer Night’s Dream at TFNA Brooklyn NY. Film: Midsummer Night’s Dream (dir. Julie Taymor). Ciaran is a Young Arts USA 2015 Winner and Alumni and has performed at the Baryshnikov Center where he was directed by Mikhail Baryshnikov as part of the Young Arts regionals. Ciaran has just played Billy Bigelow in LaGuardia’s production of Carousel directed by Harry Shifman and is really looking forward to working with him again on this project. Ciaran would like to thank his LaGuardia family especially Sandy Faison, Harry Shifman, and voice coach Kamel Boutros for their continued support. www.ciaranbowling.com

Yael Rizowy (Sam) Yael is ecstatic to ride the Held Momentarily train for the third time! She recently graduated Cum Laude with her B.F.A in Musical Theater from The Boston Conservatory. Off-Broadway: Held Momentarily (Sam) with Fringe Encores. Other theater credits: Broken Heart Syndrome (Evie-principal) 59E59, Kiss Me Kate Commonwealth Shakespeare Company, Naomi in the Living Room (Naomi) The Boston Conservatory, Macbeth (First Witch) Earthstone Theater Company, and Hairspray (Tracy) LaGuardia Arts High School. Film: Settle, Suffer, Repeat. and The Professor. Improv: UCB. Yael is happy to be back in NYC collaborating with good friends, and ready to give birth to this baby all over again! Thanks to the cast and crew of HELD, Lisa Rochelle, Thomas Gregg, and my father (the Einstein look-a-like) for all their endless support and wisdom. 1.2.3 PUSH! www.yaelrizowy.com

Geena Quintos (Mindy) Geena is beyond excited to be rejoining the cast of Held Momentarily! She played the role of Mindy in Held Momentarily at the SoHo Playhouse as part of the Fringe Encore series. More credits include; Broadway: Miss Saigon. Off-Broadway: Held Momentarily at The Soho Playhouse (Mindy). National Tour: A Chorus Line (Connie). Regional Theatre: Miss Saigon at The Paramount Theatre (Mimi/Ensemble), A Chorus Line (Asst. Director/Connie), A Midsummer Night’s Dream (Hermia), and Seascape with Sharks and Dancer (Tracy), both at The Little Flower Theater. Special Event: One Thrilling Combination: A Celebration of Marvin Hamlisch at The Delacorte Theater (Connie/Dance Ensemble), What Women Do (And Men Too): A Romantic Farce (Dora), Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade with AIM Dance Co. (Dancer). Film: Robot Stories (TriBeCa Film Festival). National TV and Commercials. Training: LaGuardia High of Performing Arts at Lincoln Center, American Musical and Dramatic Academy. All my love!

Sundance Productions, Inc (General Management)

David Coffman – Managing Director, General Manager

Diana Lounsbury – Associate General Manager

Located in the heart of Times Square, Sundance Productions is a global entertainment and production firm specializing in live stage production, theatrical licensing, and theatrical consulting. With services ranging from casting, contracting, artist liaison and support, to professional management of administrative, creative, and technical theatrical issues, the agency coordinates all logistical elements concerning theatrical performances.

Under the leadership of David Coffman as Managing Director, the company takes particular pride in working with the most creative and successful production teams in theatre today, including: current theatrical licensing deals for CATS and ROCK OF AGES in Mexico City, Queen Esther Marrow’s The Harlem Gospel Singers Show, and the international touring production of West Side Story. Previous productions and associations include: 3 MO DIVAS, Tanguera, Grease (casting), Latin Heat, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theatre, Martha Graham Dance Company, BLACKBIRDS OF BROADWAY, and 4 GUYS NAMED JOSE. Sundance works in association with its parent company BB-Promotion GmbH, one of the largest commercial theatrical producing and touring companies in Europe. www.bb-promotion.com

story:
We're Duende, and we've been making shows in Adelaide since 2009. Last year - after a bit of a hiatus - we began exploring self-identity, gender-identity and where we come from - what our legacies are. That lead us down lots of twisty paths, until, one night, we got together and read Duncan Graham's play, Ollie and the Minotaur.

The play clicked wih us. It was exactly what we'd been exploring - and more - in a beautiful, funny, brutal unravelling. A play that deserved another look. Tentatively, we lifted up the covers on Ollie - and for the last year, have been rehearsing together. 

Our excitement at premiering this show for Fringe 2016 is huge! We really can't wait! It has been a couple of years since our last show, and we are very keen to show the world what we've been working on. For the first time ever, we're asking for your support.

We're a small, independent company, and we want Ollie to be the best it can be. With your help, we truly believe that Ollie and the Minotaur will be a highlight of the Adelaide Fringe.

The funds you donate will help us in many ways to realize Ollie; we will  use the money to promote the show, working with a professional designer. We will use some of the funds to send out posters, flyers to hopefully get as many bums on seats as possible!

Also we will use the money for our production costs, and to pay our amazing lighting designer Daniel Barber, and our incredible sound designer, Nick Russell. Ollie requires that little financial push so we can create the best possible show, and present Duende to the world, again, in the most perfect light.

With your help, Ollie will be our proudest theatrical moment.

Duende have been making shows since 2009. We started in Fringe 2010 with "The Embryos", which enjoyed a sell-out season, and was nominated for two awards, the Jill Blewett's Playwright's Award, and the ATG award for Best Ensemble.

Other productions include "Play Off," "Theatre Ltd 3", "German Diary," "Truth Teller" and "No Hello."

Our previous two works were our most ambitious and challenging. "Slicing and Dicing!!!" directed by Peter Dunn, featured nearly 20 performers, a stage completely covered in plastic, a live band, copious violence and nudity,  and buckets of blood. It was a huge hit for us.

Then there was "sex play", which was the first funded production we'd ever mounted. Staring Laura Brenko, Amy  Victoria Brooks and Nate Porteus, and directed by Dee Easton, it was a surreal, elegiac exploration of sexuality and love. We loved it, and so did most of our audience.

Standing out in Fringe  - with 1000 other shows to contend with - can be very difficult. Our track record -  ("The Embryos" 2010, "No Hello" 2011, "Truth Teller" / "German Diary" 2012)  three Fringe shows under our belts, three successful shows done and dusted - indicates we know how to work in the Fringe. But still, it will be a challenge, and having the finances to push the marketing of the show will make a huge difference.

Likewise, finding the time to rehearse, and create a show, when we're all working at our "day-jobs" can be really tough - but once again, with your help, we will be able to partially fund our rehearsal period, making a brilliant show much more achieveable.

story:
Boogie 7 Collective (B7C), a group of accomplished dancers, choreographers, and actors and, most important, passionate artists with the love of all things dance. Our program offers dance choreography and dance education, focusing on professionalism, dance etiquette, discipline, hard work and unity. This summer, B7C will put together an event to celebrate diversity in arts, culture and history. With your help, Boogie 7 Collective will have funding to launch National Dance Day and spread arts awareness in the city of Jacksonville, Florida. Monies received will help the following:

Venues (Workshop, Showcase)

Marketing (Flyers, T-shirts, Wristbands, Bags, ads)

Sound Equipment

Choreographer's Expenses (Hotel, Flight)

Food (Water, Snacks)

story:
Dear Friends and Family,

I'm currently a part of the BFA Program at New World School of the Arts College in Miami, FL. This program challenges us as dancers and artists as we train full-time in all aspects of technical training and repertory. Some of the techniques include Ballet, Alignment, Composition, Graham, Horton, Limon, and Movement Analysis. New World provides us with all the tools we need as emerging artists to head out into the Professional world. (Which we all know is a scary yet beautiful place.) As the program does provide us with fundamentals, it is up to us to venture out and find where we best fit. 
As I wrap up my 2nd year with the program, it feels as though Graduation is nearby and I need to get my big boy pants on and figure out where my dance journey is headed. I'm being pretty ambitious with my energy this Summer and hoping to have completed 3 intensive programs by the end of it. Doug Varone in NY, Mark Morris in NY, and River North Choreographic Initiative in Chicago. 
http://www.dougvaroneanddancers.org/summer.php
http://markmorrisdancegroup.org/dance-center/mmdg-intensives/Summer-Intensives
http://rivernorthchicago.com/event/elite-choreographic-initiative/
Above are links to the intensives and provide further insight on what one will get out of the program. Feel free to search these incredible artists and their works!

Where am I going with this?

Most of the time intensives provide some sort of financial aid when applying. With my luck, the ones I wish to go to do not! Yay! Keeping cost of housing, flights, and as much Ramen Noodles and Cereal I would need to survive in mind, I am hoping to fundraise up to $3000.

As my experience and knowledge continues to grow, I am hoping to create a future for myself as well as build the experience to empower the community in Dance. The experience will allow me to train and also begin to create a network which I can dive into once I graduate. 

Although I'll be partaking in the physical aspect of it all, there is certainly no way I can do it without help from loved ones. Going to school full-time as well as working full-time just isn't enough for what I would like to get out of this Summer. I want nothing more to be able to expand and really dig deep into the career that I've chosen. I'm sure that each and every one of you feels the same about what you're passionate about. Assist me in continuing my passion and there will be nothing but eternal gratitude in doing so. (Along with any leftover Ramen Noodles and Cereal up for grabs.)

Thank you for your support.

story:
Theatre-at-Large, the company that brought the award winning (and audience loved) production of Next to Normal  to the North Bay last season is back again! In Fall 2015/Winter 2016 we will be presenting the Sondheim/Lapine hit Into the Woods with an ALL-STAR cast. Kim Bromley directs and Andrew Klein music directs. We are raising funds to pay our talented actors stipends for sharing their time and talents to bring this wonderful production to life at Novato Theater Playhouse and Spreckels Theatre Company. Already cast are the award winning and popular actors Dani Innocenti Beem (The Witch), Anthony Martinez (The Wolf/Cinderella's Prince) and Alison Peltz (The Baker's Wife). The remaining 12 other parts will be cast in June and the audition slots are already filled with talented, local favorites. We are excited to see which of these actors will round out our cast and help us bring another high quality, thought-provoking, fun and entertaining theatrical experience to Bay Area audiences. Please consider making a donation to our actor's stipend fund so we can thank the professional, dedicated and highly trained performers for sharing their talents to make this show soar. For more info on us, our cast and our past work go to:  

http://www.theatre-at-large.com

story:
ABOUT THE PROJECT

We've been invited to bring the ultimate comedy horror musical to the ultimate horror convention - Bruce Campbell's HORRORFEST!

We want to bring EVIL DEAD THE MUSICAL to Bruce's convention and we want to do it right! The team behind this show have been painting Las Vegas BLOODY for years and we're coming up on our 3rd anniversary on the Las Vegas Strip. That's THREE YEARS of spraying hundreds of gallons of blood over our audiences, THREE YEARS of chainsaw-roaring awesomeness, THREE YEARS of the biggest, baddest, BLOODIEST show on the Las Vegas Strip!

We were told the show wouldn't last a month. With the support of our fans, we've shown that shows like this not only have a place in Las Vegas, but can thrive there!

The HORRORFEST project will take place August 22nd and 23rd in Chicago! We'll be performing once each night, with Bruce Campbell himself set to emcee the festivities.

We want to keep prices low so that as many fans of the show can see it as possible, and to help offset the revenue generated by potential ticket sales we are asking you to help us bring this show to the stage.

WHY WE NEED THE HELP

Our production company is relatively small and even though we have a successful show on the Las Vegas Strip, there are expenses associated with this project that are just too much for us to bear on our own. It is an amazing opportunity and an honor to be invited by Bruce Campbell himself to be a part of his very own convention, and it is something we do not want to miss out on. At the same time, we don't want to be forced to present our show using sock puppets for demons and ketchup for blood.

Where the money is to be spent: transportation to get the show to Chicago, all the props (such as the chainsaw, heads, hands, evil trees, a giant evil moose, etc) needed for the HORRORFEST Edition, a great deal of special effects makeup, TONS of blood, plus food, housing, and pay for the cast and crew!

LINKS

Evil Dead The Musical In Las Vegas FaceBook Page

Evil Dead The Musical in Las Vegas website page

ABOUT THE CREATIVE TEAM

This show is produced by Sirc Michaels Productions and is directed by Sirc Michaels. You can read Sirc's bio below.

Sirc Michaels Productions is an entertainment production company that works to hire, train, and develop the talented individuals who call Las Vegas home.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

Not everyone has the spare dollars to contribute, even though they want to help. So we are asking all of our fans to not only contribute whatever they can, but also share this with the world. You never know who might want to be a part of EVIL DEAD history and this is a great way to make that happen!

F.A.Q.s

Will there be a Splatter Zone?

Yes! This is EVIL DEAD The Musical after all, not Oklahoma! We have worked out details with the convention to ensure there will indeed be a Splatter Zone. Persons who buy splatter zone tickets will also receive a commemorative t-shirt, perfect for soaking in all the blood.

Is there an age limit on who can attend the show?

There is coarse language, violent situations, and a great deal of blood sprayed during this show. Not to mention the horror aspects of dancing demons, singing zombies, and a sinister evil moose.

So while we would not restrict anyone from attending, we recommend that you be at least 10 years old. This is a show intended for persons who can handle mature themes.

Also, we ask that parents leave their infants and toddlers at home. Unless they want them scarred for life, of course.

Where exactly will the funds go?

Here is the basic breakdown of costs for the show:

1. Royalties - $5,000

2. Special effects - $3,000

3. Sound system - $1,000

4. Costumes - $500

5. Blood - $500

6. Set construction - $1500

7. Props - $500

8. Makeup, etc - $500

9. Transportation - $5,000

10. Lodging, etc - $3,000

These are just basic items we need to pull the show off. Obviously, the more money we raise, the better the show will be!

story:
Support New Comedy Writing

After the success of last years 'Brick Lane Rabbit Hole' Barnaby, Ewa and Co. are back with a surreal new comedy 'Rimbaud Delinquent'. Working at the Rag Factory again, with no budget, but a group of talented enthusiastic young people Barnaby is presenting his wildest comedic vision yet.

With your help we can raise the small amount of money needed to bring Barnaby's insane characters, Olivia's inventive costumes and all the wonderful actor's performances to life,

It is always difficult to get your writing up and being performed, and it is the modest contributions of people like you that make it a reality. Within the harsh commercial realities of the theater industry it is loopholes like crowdfunding that breathe  life into new projects that might otherwise not have found their feet.

Where will the money go?

Mostly to cover rehearsal room hire, but also towards buying the materials to create the unique props and costumes required for this surreal story.

Perks!

We appreciate every penny that you can spare and we want to thank you. As well as an enthusiastic online thanks from the creative team, we have a variety of original concept art by Chris Hallam, Olivia Rowe and others that will be sent to you as thanks.

Come see the show

As well as contributing to the fundraising campaign please come and see the show. It is on June 12 8pm, June 13 8pm and June 14 at 6:30pm. at the Rag Factory 16 - 18 Heneage st, E1 5LJ.

Please help spread the word, contribute, use the Indiegogo share tools and hopefully we can see you on the night!

Eternal thanks,

story:
The Nollywood & African Film Critics’ Awards commonly known as The NAFCA, are internationally recognized prestigious awards for achievements in the film industry. The NAFCA Honors are given annually to recognize outstanding individuals whose lives have been marked by extraordinary personal and professional accomplishments. The NAFCA Humanitarian award recognizes individuals for their outstanding achievements and contribution to humanity.

Presentations of the NAFCA hold yearly during the second weekend in September.  The African NAFCA is designed to globally promote African Cinema and culture. The prestigious NAFCA are awards of merit and are considered the highest internationally recognized African awards in Hollywood.

The 4th African NAFCA Awards were held at the prestigious Saban Theatre in Beverly Hills this past September.

The NAFCA Special Honors were presented for the first time in 2011 to President Nelson Mandela. 

Why should you donate? Support and Show commitment to the African arts and culture which desperately needs your support; your generous donations will help these awards grow and 25% of all donations will help deliver medical aid to some people in Africa who are excluded from health care, food and educational materials. Please consider supporting us in our pre-show phase, and then come on out to support The NAFCA September 11 & 12 !

Keep in touch with our website for more details about The NAFCA.

www.AfricanNAFCA.com

Check in with us on twitter @nollywoodc

story:
WHO?  I am a 42 year old woman who is beginning a new career as a scenic and production designer.  I returned to school so that I could gain the skills that I need to contribute to making art that enriches the lives of those who see it.  The next step is to continue to develop my skills through internships so that I can obtain a job.  It is my desire to gain experience and an international perspective.  You can view my portfolio by clicking the website icon at the bottom of this page.

WHAT?/WHERE?   For the past 5+ years, I have been working toward living and working in Italy.

It is finally happening!  I was chosen for an internship this summer with La Musica Lirica in Novafeltria, Italy!

      

WHEN?  During this five week program, June 13-July 18, I will be building scenery and touring with an opera.  I will be attending 20 hours per week of Italian language lessons and working 6 days a week constructing the sets and touring with an opera.

         

WHY?  I am crowdfunding because I want this enough to ask for help.  I need this chance to make connections with other people in the theater and film business which will hopefully lead to paid work in Italy. 

The funds raised for this campaign will cover my airfare to and train costs within Italy and modest groceries.   Additionally, I am seeking another internship to follow this one to make the most of this as I begin my new career. 

In actuality, I need to raise $6K in order to meet my current responsibilities, cover basic living expenses and transportation during the internship.  I am currently working two jobs to earn the rest of the money.

This is an opportunity that I have been working toward for several years and is my dream coming true. Thank you for supporting me.

story:
Naturaleza Humana

"La falta genera al deseo", Jacques Lacan.

¿PORQUÉ TE INVITAMOS A ESTA CAMPAÑA?

PARA DESARROLLAR EL TEATRO INDEPENDIENTE NACIONAL

La directora teatral Carolina Lett está dirigiendo su próxima obra: “Naturaleza Humana”. El estreno es el próximo 14 de mayo del 2015. Falta solo un mes. Y ya tenemos el lugar de las funciones, un espacio escénico llamado Gráfica Génesis, en San José, Costa Rica.

Resulta que con los reducidos  presupuestos a los proyectos de cultura y que prácticamente no existen fondos ni apoyo al sector independiente, no tenemos dinero para completar lo que falta para llevar a cabo nuestro proyecto, ¡pero tenemos muchas ganas de hacer teatro!

WHY WE INVITE YOU TO THIS CAMPAIGN?

TO DEVELOP THE INDEPENDENT NATIONAL THEATRE

The theater director Carolina Lett is directing his next theaterplay: "Human Nature". The premiere is next May 14, 2015. Missing just one month. And we have the place of functions, a scenic area called Graph Genesis, in San José, Costa Rica.
It turns out that with reduced budgets to projects in culture and there is virtually no funding or support for the independent sector, we have no money to complete what is lacking to carry out our project, but we really wanted to do theater!


Son 5 actores maravillosos: Álvaro Marenco, Jennifer Sánchez, Maud Le Chartier, Daniel Astorga y Jaime Gutierréz. Además contamos con un súper equipo artístico y de producción, entre ellos están Mariela Richmond, Nicolás Wong, Alexandra Latishev, Mariana Delgado, Lucía Meléndez, Sylvia Sossa, Ricardo Kandler, entre muchos otros.

There are 5 wonderful actors: Alvaro Marenco, Jennifer Sanchez, Maud Le Chartier, Daniel Astorga and Jaime Gutierréz. We also have a super artistic and production team, including being Mariela Richmond, Nicholas Wong, Alexandra Latishev, Mariana Delgado, Lucía Meléndez, Sylvia Sossa, Ricardo Kandler, among many others.

Es difícil encarar el proceso creativo en un contexto desfavorable, debido al desconocimiento tácito de producciones de espectáculos independientes en pequeño formato y la enorme dificultad para generar acciones reivindicativas a nivel social.

La capacidad de producción cultural y el teatro independiente se integran para seguir generando fuentes de empleo y obtener recursos económicos para consolidar espacios, grupos y proyectos artísticos y contribuyen en el desarrollo del medio teatral costarricense y promueven un espacio de diálogo y reflexión para el público.

En Costa Rica, debido al poco presupuesto estatal dedicado a proyectos teatrales, la mayoría de grupos independientes o directores de teatro independiente buscan la forma de seguir activos y desarrollan obras no comerciales, de carácter profesional y comprometidas con la sociedad.

A pesar de subsidios insuficientes, se sigue haciendo teatro. Profesionales del medio teatral se interesan y se esfuerzan por buscar la excelencia por medio de investigaciones, laboratorios y largos periodos de ensayos para encontrar nuevos lenguajes teatrales.

#YoApoyoElTeatroIndependiente

#NaturalezaHumana


¿CUANTO CUESTA PONER EN ESCENA LA OBRA NATURALEZA HUMANA?

HOW MUCH TO PUT ON STAGE HUMAN NATURE?

Para hacer la obra y que las personas involucradas puedan dedicarle su tiempo profesional de una manera eficiente es necesario disponer de fondos que compensen ese tiempo, como en cualquier otra profesión.

To do the work and the people involved can devote his professional time in an efficient manner is necessary to have funds to compensate the time, like in any other profession.

Los costos, incluyendo utilería, alquiler de espacio escénico, pago de actores, maquillaje, vestuario, iluminación, video, animación digital y comida, son de 10 mil dólares.

The costs, including props, stage space rental, pay actors, makeup, costumes, lighting, video, digital animation and food, are $ 10,000.

Nosotros podemos cubrir la mitad de esos costos con las entradas  del los días de función en mayo, pero para el resto no tenemos presupuesto…

We can cover half of those costs to the inputs of performance days in May, but for the rest we have no budget ...

Son 4900 dólares, sí, CUATRO MIL NOVECIENTOS dólares!!!

Yes $ 4,900 FOUR HUNDRED THOUSAND dollars !!
  • Ésto será íntegramente invertido en vestuario, escenografía, equipo de iluminación, sonido, animación digital, composición musical, entre otros.
  • Estamos acostumbrados a trabajar con pocos recursos, así que todo será sabiamente administrado.
  • This will be fully invested in costumes, props, lighting equipment, sound, digital animation, music composition, among others.
  • We are accustomed to working with limited resources, so everything will be wisely managed.

¿DE QUE TRATA NATURALEZA HUMANA?

Somos seres humanos decadentes, decentes, indecentes, buenos, malos, a veces matamos, a veces damos vida, lloramos, reímos, nos revolcamos de cólera, pedimos ayuda, nos enfermamos para llamar la atención, hacemos buenos actos, vamos a la iglesia, estudiamos, nos metemos el dedo y vomitamos, tomamos antipresivos, hacemos yoga y meditación trascendental, comemos frutas y verduras orgánicas, caemos, chocamos, cogemos con una o varias personas, vamos de shopping, nos asaltan, nos roban el celular, trabajamos día y noche para pagar cuentas, seguimos pasando la tarjeta, fumamos marihuana, tomamos whisky, en la calle se fuma piedra, nos prostituimos de muchas maneras, nos tomamos fotos y las subimos a Instagram, nuestra vida se la contamos a Facebook.

Somos personas que vivimos, dormimos, comemos y nos matamos en algún lugar. Puede ser un edificio, una casa, debajo de un puente, en la calle.

¿Buscamos lo que deseamos o lo que necesitamos?

  • Nuestra propuesta está inspirada en varios textos del dramatugo Rodrigo García y en la película "Medianeras" del cineasta Gustavo Taretto. 
  • El espacio que habitamos, las personas con las que nos relacionamos, las calles que transitamos y nuestras actividades diarias nos llevaron a pensar como nos afectan a la hora de reaccionar, tomar desiciones y de comunicarnos, tanto con las personas que están a nuestro alrededor, como con nosotros mismos. Tenemos grandes aspiraciones, al mismo tiempo prohibiciones, acciones de sabotaje y de sumisión de uno mismo. Queremos libertades pero nos oprimen. ¿Cómo hacer para mantenernos en la rutina? Buscar lo que no tenemos.
  • Son 5 actores que darán vida a diferentes personajes que todos conocemos en la realidad, en una historia o en televisión. Son personas que habitan entre nosotros, con nosotros y delante de nosotros. Aunque no los conocemos personalmente, sabemos que existen. Cada uno encarna el deseo: de vida, de muerte, de amor, de trabajo, de sexo, de fama, de tristeza y de soledad, donde todos estamos inmersos.
  • NATURALEZA HUMANA es una obra para reírnos de nosotros mismos y para evidenciar en lo que todos hemos caído: una sociedad manipuladora, light, con censuras y opresiones.
  • Esta es una obra para mayores de 16 años.
  • La duración es de 70 minutos.


¿QUIENES SON LOS ACTORES?

Jaime Gutiérrez Sáenz (como el profesor Mitto)
Nació el 29 de abril de 1989. Trabajador independiente del teatro, con experiencia en talleres internacionales como Yuyachkani (Perú), Malayerba (Ecuador), miembro del colectivo latinoamericano Âmbar, su última puesta en escena: "Carmesí Dulce Tentación" en la temporada de "Una puesta al fuego" de la Universidad Nacional de Costa Rica. 
Diseñador y creativo de la vida.

Maud Le Chartier (como "la inmigrante Maud")

Nació el 30 de agosto de 1980. Francesa radicada en Costa Rica. Master en filología española y en Enseñanza y Pedagogía del francés (Universidad de Nantes, Francia).   Actriz en "Linea infinita" (2015), "El sueño de unos Reyes" (2014-2015),  "Pájaros tristes" (2013), "Sueño de una noche de verano" (2003-2004). 

Profesora de teatro para adolescentes y niños, Companía Mano&Co , Nantes.

Encargada de misión pedagógica de Francia en Costa Rica.



Álvaro Marenco Marrochi (como "Álvaro Marengo")

Nació un 22 de Abril de 1943. Actor de profesión. Realizó sus estudios en la Universidad Complutense de Madrid, Universidad La Sorbona de París, Universidad Internacional de Teatro en París y en la Universidad Nacional de Costa Rica. 

Ha trabajado en 118 obras de teatro, 60 coreografías e inumerables trabajos en audiovisual, en Costa Rica, Francia, México y Chile. 

Trabajó a lo largo de 33 años en el Conservatorio Castella, Universidad Nacional, Universidad de Costa Rica, Ministerio de Cultura, director de la Escuela de Danza de la Universidad Nacional, Agregado Cultural de Costa Rica en Chile, etc. 


Daniel Astorga Arrieta (como "Dha's Ant")

Nació un 22 de setiembre de 1988. Inició sus estudios teatrales en la Academia  Giratablas en 2005, y prosiguió en el Taller Nacional de Teatro (gen 2007) de donde egresó con la obra “Jardín de Pulpos”. Con estudios en danza contemporánea en el Taller Nacional de Danza, así como talleres de Técnica Lecoq impartidos por Tatjana Didier, Improvisación Teatral por Didier Maes, Cuerpo y Voz por Marcela Aguilar, y Comedia Física. Ha participado en diversos montajes como “Caosmos”, “Hamlet García”, "Coctel de Sapos", “Identidades”, “Espejos” y “20 de noviembre”. Diseñador de movimiento corporal de espectáculos como “Hera, mujeres al poder” y “Ellas, nosotras y ustedes”. Ha trabajado en cortos, videos musicales y cine. Se encuentra en el montaje de su primera dirección "Sucesiones". Arquitecto.

Jennifer Sánchez

Nace un 7 de Marzo de 1990. Se forma en el Teatro Independiente "La Máscara debutando con la obra "Un Viernes de Locura" en el 2011, le siguieron “Esperando la Carroza”, “Sufridas pero Felices” y “El Juego”. En el 2014 incursiona en cine con la película “Presos” de próximo estreno, 2 cortometrajes “Contraentrega” y “Juliana” y actualmente realiza un papel en la película corta " Lobas". En teatro, además de  "Naturaleza Humana" participa en el montaje de "El Infiernos Son Los Otros" de estreno en 2015.


¿QUIEN ES LA DIRECTORA DE NATURALEZA HUMANA?

Carolina Lett

Carolina nace el 4 de setiembre de 1986. Inicia sus estudios de arquitectura y años más tarde decide abandonar por completo su carrera para dedicarse al teatro. Ingresa al Taller Nacional de Teatro (San José, Costa Rica) y continúa sus estudios en Buenos Aires, Argentina, llevando clases de dirección, dramaturgia y producción con los maestros Ricardo Bartís, Mauricio Kartún, Pompeyo Audivert, Rubén Szuchmacher, Claudio Tolcachir, Lorena Barutta, entre otros. Dirigió la obra “Ellas, Nosotras y Ustedes” beneficiada por los fondos PROARTES en el 2013, ha realizado varias asistencias de dirección tanto en Buenos Aires como en San José y ha trabajado como productora en varias obras de teatro, danza y eventos para la Compañía Nacional de Teatro, Iberescena, etc.

Su vínculo con el cine la lleva a estudiar y trabajar como Diseñadora de Producción o Directora de Arte. Ha trabajado en 6 cortometrajes, 3 video clips y 4 películas nacionales: “Viaje” de Paz Fábrega, “Presos” de Esteban Ramírez, “Entonces Nosotros” de Hernán Jiménez y la próxima película de Miguel Gómez actualmente en producción. En el 2008 el cortometraje “La Piel Cansada” fue ganador en el Festival de Cine Costarricese como mejor dirección de arte.


GRACIAS POR TU APOYO!
story_txt:
Naturaleza Humana
"La falta genera al deseo", Jacques Lacan.




¿PORQUÉ TE INVITAMOS A ESTA CAMPAÑA?

PARA DESARROLLAR EL TEATRO INDEPENDIENTE NACIONAL
La directora teatral Carolina Lett está dirigiendo su próxima
obra: “Naturaleza Humana”. El estreno es el próximo 14 de mayo del 2015. Falta solo un mes. Y ya tenemos el lugar de las funciones, un
espacio escénico llamado Gráfica Génesis, en San José, Costa Rica.
Resulta que con los reducidos  presupuestos a los proyectos de cultura y que prácticamente
no existen fondos ni apoyo al sector independiente, no tenemos dinero para
completar lo que falta para llevar a cabo nuestro proyecto, ¡pero tenemos muchas
ganas de hacer teatro!
WHY WE INVITE YOU TO THIS CAMPAIGN?
TO DEVELOP THE INDEPENDENT NATIONAL THEATRE
The theater director Carolina Lett is directing his next theaterplay: "Human Nature". The premiere is next May 14, 2015. Missing just one month. And we have the place of functions, a scenic area called Graph Genesis, in San José, Costa Rica.It turns out that with reduced budgets to projects in culture and there is virtually no funding or support for the independent sector, we have no money to complete what is lacking to carry out our project, but we really wanted to do theater!


Son 5 actores maravillosos: Álvaro Marenco, Jennifer Sánchez,
Maud Le Chartier, Daniel Astorga y Jaime Gutierréz. Además contamos con un súper
equipo artístico y de producción, entre ellos están Mariela Richmond, Nicolás
Wong, Alexandra Latishev, Mariana Delgado, Lucía Meléndez, Sylvia Sossa, Ricardo
Kandler, entre muchos otros. 
There are 5 wonderful actors: Alvaro Marenco, Jennifer Sanchez, Maud Le Chartier, Daniel Astorga and Jaime Gutierréz. We also have a super artistic and production team, including being Mariela Richmond, Nicholas Wong, Alexandra Latishev, Mariana Delgado, Lucía Meléndez, Sylvia Sossa, Ricardo Kandler, among many others.
Es difícil encarar el proceso creativo en un contexto desfavorable, debido al desconocimiento tácito de producciones de espectáculos independientes en
pequeño formato y la enorme dificultad para generar acciones reivindicativas a
nivel social. 
La capacidad de producción cultural y el teatro independiente se integran para seguir generando fuentes de empleo y obtener recursos económicos para consolidar espacios, grupos y proyectos artísticos y contribuyen en el desarrollo del medio teatral costarricense y promueven un espacio de diálogo y reflexión para el público.
En Costa Rica, debido al poco presupuesto estatal dedicado a
proyectos teatrales, la mayoría de grupos independientes o directores de teatro
independiente buscan la forma de seguir activos y desarrollan obras no
comerciales, de carácter profesional y comprometidas con la sociedad. 
A pesar de subsidios insuficientes, se sigue haciendo teatro. Profesionales
del medio teatral se interesan y se esfuerzan por buscar la excelencia por
medio de investigaciones, laboratorios y largos periodos de ensayos para
encontrar nuevos lenguajes teatrales.
#YoApoyoElTeatroIndependiente
#NaturalezaHumana







¿CUANTO CUESTA PONER EN ESCENA LA OBRA NATURALEZA HUMANA?
HOW MUCH TO PUT ON STAGE HUMAN NATURE?
Para hacer la obra y que las personas involucradas puedan
dedicarle su tiempo profesional de una manera eficiente es necesario disponer
de fondos que compensen ese tiempo, como en cualquier otra profesión.
To do the work and the people involved can devote his professional time in an efficient manner is necessary to have funds to compensate the time, like in any other profession.
Los costos, incluyendo utilería, alquiler de espacio escénico,
pago de actores, maquillaje, vestuario, iluminación, video, animación digital y
comida, son de 10 mil dólares.
The costs, including props, stage space rental, pay actors, makeup, costumes, lighting, video, digital animation and food, are $ 10,000.

Nosotros podemos cubrir la mitad de esos costos con las
entradas  del los días de función
en mayo, pero para el resto no tenemos presupuesto… 
We can cover half of those costs to the inputs of performance days in May, but for the rest we have no budget ...
Son 4900 dólares, sí, CUATRO MIL NOVECIENTOS dólares!!!
Yes $ 4,900 FOUR HUNDRED THOUSAND dollars !!


Ésto será íntegramente invertido en vestuario, escenografía, equipo de iluminación, sonido, animación
digital, composición musical, entre otros.
Estamos acostumbrados a trabajar con pocos recursos, así que todo será sabiamente administrado.
This will be fully invested in costumes, props, lighting equipment, sound, digital animation, music composition, among others.
We are accustomed to working with limited resources, so everything will be wisely managed.

¿DE QUE TRATA NATURALEZA HUMANA?




Somos seres humanos decadentes, decentes, indecentes, buenos, malos, a veces matamos, a veces damos vida, lloramos, reímos, nos revolcamos de cólera, pedimos ayuda, nos enfermamos para llamar la atención, hacemos buenos actos, vamos a la iglesia, estudiamos, nos metemos el dedo y vomitamos, tomamos antipresivos, hacemos yoga y meditación trascendental, comemos frutas y verduras orgánicas, caemos, chocamos, cogemos con una o varias personas, vamos de shopping, nos asaltan, nos roban el celular, trabajamos día y noche para pagar cuentas, seguimos pasando la tarjeta, fumamos marihuana, tomamos whisky, en la calle se fuma piedra, nos prostituimos de muchas maneras, nos tomamos fotos y las subimos a Instagram, nuestra vida se la contamos a Facebook.
Somos personas que vivimos, dormimos, comemos y nos matamos en algún lugar. Puede ser un edificio, una casa, debajo de un puente, en la calle.
¿Buscamos lo que deseamos o lo que necesitamos?





Nuestra propuesta está inspirada en varios textos del dramatugo Rodrigo García y en la película "Medianeras" del cineasta Gustavo Taretto. 

El espacio que habitamos, las personas con las que nos relacionamos, las calles que transitamos y nuestras actividades diarias nos llevaron a pensar como nos afectan a la hora de reaccionar, tomar desiciones y de comunicarnos, tanto con las personas que están a nuestro alrededor, como con nosotros mismos. Tenemos grandes aspiraciones, al mismo tiempo prohibiciones, acciones de sabotaje y de sumisión de uno mismo. Queremos libertades pero nos oprimen. ¿Cómo hacer para mantenernos en la rutina? Cada uno encarna el deseo: de vida, de muerte, de amor, de trabajo, de sexo, de fama, de tristeza y de soledad, donde todos estamos inmersos.


NATURALEZA HUMANA es una obra para reírnos de nosotros mismos y para evidenciar en lo que todos hemos caído: una sociedad manipuladora, light, con censuras y opresiones.

story:
After years of development and lots of laughs, Temerity Theatre Co. brings the new play "The Addicts" by Ed Malin to Theater For The New City, NYC April 16-May 3, 2015.    The production is directed by Janet Bentley and stars Ian Campbell Dunn, Brian Karim, Ashlee Danielle, Daniela Thome, Gonçalo Ruivo, David Bonfim, and Daniel Deutsch.  In this play, the Jewish Supporters of Christ try out their new marketing approach on the Black Hebrew Israelite community.  During his door-to-door missionary work, Stephen Zuckerman meets Isaac Rabinowitz, only they originally met and loved each other in college.  What happens next?  Why do people (and empires and superpowers) go from one addictive behavior to another?
This year, Ed's work has been included in the "Plays and Playwrights 2015" anthology from Indietheaternow and will be presented in the United Solo Festival in the Fall.  Since our last Indiegogo campaign in 2013, Temerity Theatre has presented "The Troubadour Struck By Lightning" at Dixon Place and

“Óscar Tango-Bravo” in Frigid New York Festival.  We thank you so much for your support.

After years of development and lots of laughs, Temerity Theatre Co. brings the new play "The Addicts" by Ed Malin to Theater For The New City, NYC April 16-May 3, 2015.    The production is directed by Janet Bentley and stars Ian Campbell Dunn, Brian Karim, Ashlee Danielle, Daniela Thome, Gonçalo Ruivo, David Bonfim, and Daniel Deutsch.  In this play, the Jewish Supporters of Christ try out their new marketing approach on the Black Hebrew Israelite community.  During his door-to-door missionary work, Stephen Zuckerman meets Isaac Rabinowitz, only they originally met and loved each other in college.  What happens next?  Why do people (and empires and superpowers) go from one addictive behavior to another?This year, Ed's work has been included in the "Plays and Playwrights 2015" anthology from Indietheaternow and will be presented in the United Solo Festival in the Fall.  Since our last Indiegogo campaign in 2013, Temerity Theatre has presented "The Troubadour Struck By Lightning" at Dixon Place and 
“Óscar
Tango-Bravo” in Frigid New York Festival.  We thank you so much for your support.
